Customer facing service to support the Retail End to End integrated team (General Public and where applicable Loyalty, Digital). The Customer Success Specialist Loyalty needs to project a professional company image by providing the best customer experience through phone interaction, emails, ticketing, live chat and social media engagements with Customers. The Customer Success Specialist Loyalty delivers effective communications, value-adding interactions and efficient issue resolution.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Taking ownership for the resolution of Integrated Retail B2C complaints, feedback and compliments, liaising with other service partners as required<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Taking care of reports regarding promotions, third party offers, gift delivery, balance enquiry, Premium membership<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Handling transaction queries, self-serve queries and general loyalty related enquiries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supporting Performance of compliance checks on manual data quality control<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supporting the redeeming and transferring of Customer Loyalty points<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supporting Data Integrity Management, by embedding right-first-time accountability and ownership of Customer data quality inputted at system<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Liaising with internal interfaces within the agreed processes and ways of working<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supporting Shell’s Customers on digital channels and proactively encourage self-support solutions, ensuring customers are aware of the information and tools on the website and mobile application<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Polish Language Proficiency – C2\u002FNative<\u002Fli>\n    <li> English Language Proficiency – B2<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> Other Skills &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Job Purpose<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Group Screening Service (GSS) team provides a third party screening service to the Shell Group to assess counterparty risks related to money laundering, bribery corruption, tax evasion, trade controls including terrorist financing or other related financial crimes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The team leader will lead by example and be accountable for building and maintaining team performance, engagement and drive for continuous improvement. The team leader will be a natural hands-on leader that drives performance, planning, processes and develops people along the way.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position will allow you to gain expertise in in third party screening services and implementing new tools and systems in the team. You will be able to further develop your leaderships skills while being exposed to a broad range of stakeholders across different functions at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Planning and organization of team's work, providing first-line supervision and leadership for a team size of 10 staff.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Delivering screening assessments and ensure screening reports are recorded accurately and communicated appropriately.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Acting as the Subject Matter Expert for screening searches and undertake non-standard searches that are either; complex, commercially sensitive, strictly confidential or involve a new set of circumstances not previously encountered,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicating team’s performance status and needs to the GSS Service Lead and provide monthly service level metrics details.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Managing team’s involvement in programmes of internal and external audit, information management and other Compliance reviews.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In conjunction with the Operations Excellence team dedicating resources to continuous improvement activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identifying process improvements and participating in major change programs if required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team Lead will support the Service Lead to develop &amp; enhance these services to build stakeholder value by centralising &amp; standardising group-wide ethics &amp; compliance support services.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum of 2 years’ experience in sanctions screening in a risk, fraud, compliance or analytical role,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prior experience in leading, motivating, coaching and developing teams,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Legal, Finance or Business related university degree,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good level of English,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to liaise with senior stakeholders, both within legal &amp; compliance and the business,<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. about?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You would be responsible for the daily support of Shell Employees in resolving their queries on HR policies and processes, supporting them in maintaining their personal data in the system, ensuring they know how they should proceed in those everyday life situations, when they move locations, have a promotion, need to resign from work, feel unwell, have a baby and many more.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will be crucial in ensuring exceptional employee experience and by that helping employees feel supported and focused on their roles instead of HR concerns. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Shell Trading &amp; Supply<\u002Fb> has a global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, LNG, chemicals natural gas, electrical power, and CO2. This particular role will be supporting the Trading and Supply business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> We are interested in attracting people to our business who share our core working values of honesty, integrity, and respect for others.<\u002Fb> We also want those who <b>can build on our business vision<\u002Fb>, are prepared to accept accountability and can achieve great results through <b>teamwork<\u002Fb> while adapting to a changing business environment. The successful candidate will be part of a team of Operations Support Analysts in Krakow. This support includes tasks critical to the completion of cargo movements such as nomination creation and maintenance, invoicing, cargo document handling, and reporting for both internal and external customers. The scope of the team changes as business needs change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> You will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work closely with interdependent groups such as Deal Implementation, Operations Scheduling, and Finance, develop relationships with those teams and ensure that processes are working effectively and efficiently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fulfill all ticketing requests (manual recording of actual loaded quantities) in 3rd party depots which include creation, adjustment, and deletion of tickets in the system. Investigate and solve any errors with the postings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Update all necessary reports on a daily basis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain Operations manuals and other material on the Operations onboarding website. Routinely examine existing and new procedures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Seek process improvements and efficiency. Participate in assigned LEAN or Continuous Improvement projects, building knowledge and experience of methodology and tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University degree and\u002For equivalent work experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidenced ability to cover multiple roles, including roles on other desks and taking on additional projects, and handle a high volume of transactions in an efficient and accurate manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to deal with competing priorities and be able to maximize value in a fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good level of English (B2 min).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of SAP is preferable, and proficiency in Microsoft Excel would be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Job Purpose<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Customer Success Specialist (CSS) is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers. This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash journeys forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfillment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. CSS provides <b>C<\u002Fb>onsistent, <b>A<\u002Fb>daptive, <b>R<\u002Fb>eliable and <b>E<\u002Fb>asy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principle Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key business serviced is Fleet Solutions. These activities cover all customer levels including Key Accounts and Platinum Customers. The broad accountability of this role is to take ownership, drive accountability, and demonstrate and communicate improvements for our customer journey. This means being a single focal point for our customer, as well as caring for our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The CSS is accountable for a certain customer portfolio (mirroring one ore more AM portfolios) to drive accountability\u002Fownership for this portfolio. This is a key enabler to drive best-in-class CX and to ensure maximum customer-centricity.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role may focus on some or all the accountabilities below, depending on the respective businesses size and complexity:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Deal Management<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bid and Tender<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Pricing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Master Data Set-up and Amend<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Data Integrity Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Enforcing company’s policy and contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring compliance (Data privacy, trade compliance, SDS, etc)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Troubleshooting<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Order to Cash<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Order Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Touchless Support and Set-up<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Dispute Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Credit Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> General Inquiries and Feedback<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Meeting and\u002For managing customer’s expectations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring invoices are correct and paid on time<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Building strong relationships and creating partners (customers) for life<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Getting as much information and notes as necessary to understand customer’s issues and to drive resolution and improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Job Knowledge, Skills and Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Language<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> English Language Proficiency – C1<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Shell <b>Trading &amp; Supply<\u002Fb> has a global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, LNG, chemicals, natural gas, electrical power, and CO2.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <p> This particular role will be supporting the <b>Trading and Supply Business<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Reporting to the <b>Financial Crime <\u002Fb><b>Due Diligence <\u002Fb><b>Team Lead<\u002Fb>, the FC Due Diligence Specialist is part of the Counterparty Lifecycle team within Global Operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <p> The team undertakes periodic Counterparty review – the checking of potentially adverse information relating to a counterparty which may impact our willingness to transact with them.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Review the risk profile and business activity of counterparties due for re-review.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Complete re-reviews at different levels of due diligence depending on the risk profile. Risk assessments to include analysis of findings, identification of any red flags and mitigation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Confirm the nature of the business relationship and obtain required company information\u002Fdocumentation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Analyse substantial amounts of data including transactional data.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Verify evidence obtained and identify red flags and other areas of concern.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Prepare documentation to support discussion with Team Leads on counterparties with significant financial crime risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> We are looking for candidates who have education to degree level or above (or equivalent work experience), in addition, we'd hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Understanding of Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions, Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) &amp; Know Your Customer (KYC) policies\u002Fprocesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Understanding of high-risk jurisdictions and their associated risks, global sanctions requirements, the risks of dealing with Politically Exposed Persons, and corporate and complex entity structures including Special Purpose Vehicles, Trusts, and Funds, including identification of Ultimate Beneficial Owners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Professional experience in a counterparty onboarding role within a Financial Institution including ability to research information and undertake counterparty outreach to obtain required documentation for Counterparty Due Diligence.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication in English - C1.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Intermediate level of computer literacy (MS Office suite products: Excel, PowerPoint and Word).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The <b>CP\u002FSC Analyst – Data Operations<\u002Fb> position will be accountable for the E2E operational data set-up, supplier qualification, and continuous improvement opportunities for a particular business. This position will interface with multiple stakeholders across Contracting &amp; Procurement (CP) Operations, Supply Chain (SC) or CP-in-Business and across the e2e natural partners outside SC\u002FCP e.g. IT, Accounts Payable etc. <br> <br> He\u002Fshe must ensure the Data operating model delivers business value in the new macro context. This would require working with the respective Data stakeholders within and outside CP\u002FSC to develop and operate accurate and reliable CP\u002FSC data, enabling businesses to improve its financial performance, safeguard license to operate and achieve CP\u002FSC goals (eg availability, cost etc). Data must be reliable, enable digitalisation, and is trusted. This allows Shell to maximise bottom line impact from operational spend and in parallel liberating time for asset-based Business and CP\u002FSC colleagues. <br> <br> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Partner with frontline CP, Suppliers, functional teams and other CP Data Operational teams to ensure business requirements are met within target timelines<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure Data Quality (Right First time, Data is Trusted) in place<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure operationalisation of data designs that can eliminate waste, transform towards right-first time and strong data quality. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The SEAM organization integrates Safety, Environment &amp; Asset Management activities, with a broad geographical footprint, that will support Shell’s business &amp; assets around the world. Technical Asset Operations (TAO), which sits in SEAM, is a key enabler for the accelerated delivery of Shell’s Asset Management System and will help us to reach our ultimate potential in Chemicals and Products (C+P), Integrated Gas\u002FRenewables and Energy Solutions (IGRES) and Upstream. TAO provides high-quality and cost-competitive technical resources who are not physically present at a site yet are an integral part of asset teams delivering value through end-to-end AMS work processes. The TAO teams are located across 4 locations: Chennai, Manila, KL &amp; Krakow.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Process Data Engineer<\u002Fb> for Reservoir Engineering is expected to be connected with various subsurface and reservoir engineering colleagues in assets and streamline and document the data management process. The scope of the work covers also helps the Well, Reservoir, and Facility Management (WRFM) community in extracting the required data for any WRFM review process, as well as helps the assets in capturing fluid, pressure, and reservoir properties, and managing key subsurface uncertainties. The candidate is expected to have good Knowledge of reservoir performance analysis and maturation of hydrocarbon volumes. Experience in analyzing and reporting HC Resource volume data, Subsurface\u002FProduction Benchmarking, Annual Business Planning, and Reserves Reporting to SEC are added advantages.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work closely with Assets \u002F Reservoir Engineer in maintaining and providing necessary access\u002Fdata for various reservoir studies\u002Freviews.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand and provide support on necessary reports &amp; workflows during the annual reporting cycles (internal and external).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Reserves Reporting, Subsurface Benchmarking, and Portfolio Analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Integrate subsurface data types such as production, pressures, etc. to present meaningful insights using industry-standard data visualization tools. Perform quality checks and connect with relevant stakeholders for verification\u002Frectification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Assets with Reserves estimation and classification, Decline Curve Analysis (DCA) based Production Forecasting, Well Test interpretation, and MBAL Modelling.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in reservoir engineering network and share key achievements and challenge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a team player and assist other colleagues in reservoir engineering processes\u002Fworkflows as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University Degree in Geoscience, Reservoir engineering, Petroleum Engineering, or relevant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Required 2+ yrs experience in relevant areas such as Field Development Planning, Reservoir Studies, Production Forecasting, Subsurface Benchmarking, Annual Reserves Reporting, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good Data Management skills in identifying data sources, analyzing data quality, and providing reliable data.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of various data types such as production, injection, fluid, pressure, reservoir properties, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A good understanding of end-to-end Upstream Asset Development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skills in Data analysis (using Python), data integration (using VBA, Power Query), and visualization (using Spotfire, PowerBI) are added advantages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in applying Continuous Improvement methods for process improvements is a good addition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n risks related to money laundering, trade controls including terrorist financing or other related financial crimes. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   Please note that this role will be on SBO Terms and Conditions\n   <br> Customer Operations is in its journey to provide the best in market customer experience for our Customers and Business Partners in Shell. We create the great place for commercially minded individuals who thrive working with customers and who want to growth their experience in agile, digital and e-commerce initiatives.\n   <br> We have a collaborative, flexible, dynamic and very supportive working culture; where every single one of us is determined to make a difference, to go the extra mile because it’s our job, every day, to make our customers’ experiences with Shell that little bit better. We believe in creating an inclusive culture and work environment where you can thrive, innovate and develop; but most of all, be yourself. Want to bring more – JOIN US!\n   <br> \n   <br> Where You Fit In\n   <br> Success for Customer Operations is providing market leading Customer Experience, generating revenue for Shell and, providing a modern and engaging employee experience augmented by technology. We are fully end-to-end integrated with business partners we work with. We approach our work by ensuring brilliant basics of our work, being fundamentally digital and an agile organization. We also ensure that our customer experience we deliver are segmented according to their needs.\n   <br> What is the Role?\n   <br> E2E Delivery Lead is empowered to collaborate with business partners and stakeholders in identifying and delivering business strategies and solutions to deliver Best In Market Customer Experience and maximize business value.\n   <br> This role is part of Customer Operations Agri &amp; Constructions and supports a portfolio of businesses with C5 of $300M with different challenges in a continuously changing internal and external environment and requires the ability to build alignment and relationships with different end-to-end partners across the Customer Fulfilment process.\n   <br> \n   <br> More specifically, your role will include:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Work with business partners and stakeholders to Identify and Deliver Business Growth\u002FStrategic Projects (e.g. new business model, market entries, special deals, pricing strategy) in collaboration with CXE and Operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Identify opportunities, improve CO process efficiency, KPI performance, Customer Experience and enable business growth<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Plan and manage the Local Implementation of Global Projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Manage Implementation of Change Requests, new\u002Fchanges to System\u002F ERP\u002F Tools and Improvement Projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Lead\u002Fown rapid resolution of (complex) issues, mobilizing the right E2E partners<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide Process Expertise as per the ISM model as required<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Liaise with business partners to take action on the commercial insights coming from Voice Of Customer (VOC)<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide process expertise as per the ISM support model as required<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Support MCO in preparation and running of stakeholder engagements<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> What We Need from You?\n   <br> When it comes to leadership, it’s your proven community leadership and engagement skills that will make the difference. You will inspire people to strive for customer excellence and delivering brilliant basics. Your strong business partnering skills will ensure that you bring business partners along the journey of excellence in customer experience.\n   <br> \n   <br> Furthermore, you will have:\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A proven track record of project delivery including agile project delivery as well as experience with digitizing our backbone<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Commercial outlook with an understanding of Shell’s commercial drivers<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A proven track record of Change and Engage during deployment and changes<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Lean Practitioner or CIBC certification desirable, able to apply Continuous Improvement behaviors to lead improvement initiatives end to end<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to develop insights from data, develop creative solutions and drive change from a customer and digital perspective<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong stakeholder management skills, able to build and maintain effective relationships across several levels, including team members, business partners and leadership teams<\u002Fli>\n    <li>An understanding of customer needs and how to address through a best in market customer experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li>An understanding of E2E Customer Fulfillment process, business value chain &amp; process<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong GSAP systems knowledge &amp; experiences<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. hauliers, customers and planning teams to execute and amend loading plans, process customer enquiries and urgent orders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Act as a primary contact point for the hauliers to advise truck drivers of necessary changes to plan<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage changes and adjustments to the loading plan, i.e. process changes in SAP: product left on board, plant\u002Fdepot change, load quantity changes, compartment changes, trip sequence change, vehicle change, orders scheduled not delivered<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Receive, create and process urgent orders for a timely and accurate delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Handle customer enquiries to change\u002Famend orders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Investigate and resolve customer complaints<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure documentation and filing is accurate, up to date and accessible<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Special Challenges<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Shift working pattern: Continuously rotating shift system to provide 24-hour support in 3 x 8 hr shifts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Respond to emergency issues arising from delivery\u002Fsystem constraints<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Qualification required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This role is part of the <b>Corporate Relations function <\u002Fb>that brings together professional communicators, brand experts, government relations professionals and specialists in non-technical risk and social performance to work with commercial and technical colleagues and deliver Shell’s business strategy. The CR team will bring external analysis and perspectives to business decisions, communicate Shell to the world and drive Shell’s brand and reputation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> CR Financial Analyst<\u002Fb> role is a <b>pivotal element of the Operations Team<\u002Fb>, which ensures CR as a function has access to the Finance Experts and can stay compliant with the financial principles. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be the best at achieving successful integrated outcomes for the business through effective engagement and communication with stakeholders and audiences.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Purpose:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will be the <b>focal point for wide scope of Requisition to Pay (RtP) activities across financial teams.<\u002Fb> This position will be focused on delivering quality financial support, aligning with the budget plans for the function. We are looking for a <b>strong business partnering professional and stakeholder manager <\u002Fb>with the ability to effectively prioritise business objectives against own capacity and delivering clarity on the financial process. Further responsibilities include acting as process gate-keeper and trusted advisor to stakeholders from own area.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In the role, execution of effective, e<b>fficient Requisition-to-Pay (RtP) and Budget Management support<\u002Fb> is expected. On a daily basis, the role will provide transactional RtP support and coaching to support\u002Fadmin staff in other CR business units. Hence, the role is intended as <b>focal point for GSAP, SERP<\u002Fb> and other ERPs, to onboard new users, solve errors and fix problems.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role requires capacity to work across boundaries and seek improvements, while being compliant with the process principles. A successful candidate would need to maintain and further improve on proper budget management and good payment performance across the function, which will be done with regular cooperation with the Planning Team in CR. Apart from system\u002Fadmin tasks, the role requires upskilling stakeholders and peers in the team and providing regular updates on budget\u002Finvoices performance. Ability to <b>communicate with stakeholders with no previous experience with financial processes<\u002Fb> will be pivotal in establishing and maintaining a strong and stable relationship with project managers. The overall aim of the role is to own the CR finance process for respective VPship.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Reports to CR Operations Team Lead while keeping strong dotted lines to respective VPs in the function.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>No direct reports<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Holds responsibility for the RtP process, provides coaching and troubleshooting for Project Managers and admin\u002Fsupport staff in other CR teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Has multiple interfaces with local and global teams including Shell Business Operations in Chennai, Manila, Contracting &amp; Procurement, Accounts Payable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provides ongoing back-up support for peers in the Team.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Primary support for RtP and Budget management for Corporate Relations<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b>Provide financial insights, including live tracker tracker, accruals preparations<\u002Fb>, tracking of services delivery &amp; invoices; acting as single focal to various teams in Finance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as the CR Subject Matter Expert for RtP and related areas such as C&amp;P, IQN, Intercompany\u002FIG Billing, ECP, Master Data, VS&amp;A, Cash Management, Accounts Payable, Account Receivable, Manual of Authority (MOA), Finance, ERP processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as the primary CR RtP focal point to liaise with C&amp;P, IQN team, IG billing team (Receivable\u002FPayable), Finance, Master Data team, Cash Management, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, ECP recipient in other entities\u002Fcountries, and Ethics &amp; Compliance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as Record Focal Point (RFP) to declare SOWs and Contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as Contracts Manager for CR function, supporting creation and monitoring of external supplier Contracts and Purchase Orders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monitor and follow up on outstanding payments and oversees the trouble shooting of invoice issues such as chasing, disputes, rejections<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Coach and support CR staff on RtP processes. Promote best compliance process through learning sessions, best practice sharing, regular issues escalation and remediation process.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b>Compile and synthesise complex financial data<\u002Fb> into usable insights and analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lead interfaces with key internal and external stakeholders to influence outcomes<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Deliver fit for purpose training to staff and prepare them for any upcoming budgetary activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide high quality payment data for internal assurance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b>Communicate and influence confidently <\u002Fb>in a simple manner, drawing on professional expertise, relevant data &amp; evidence.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n The focus will be on sourcing and contracting activities, where you will manage a portfolio of contracts and handle new demands from multiple business such as Marine, Aviation, Construction and Road business stakeholders in North and Latin America, according to Category Management Contracting &amp; Procurement guidelines. Work requires close collaboration with various teams such as Business, Finance, Request To Pay (RTP).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p> You will be accountable for aggregating\u002Fleveraging third party spend, developing and executing sourcing strategy to optimize Shell’s buying power and reduce overall 3rd party expenditures. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Customer Success Specialist (CSS) is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship, and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfilment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. CSS provides Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specifically, this role includes:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Deal Management (accountable for Bid and Tender, Contract Management, Pricing, Master Data, Data Integrity Management, enforcing company’s policy and contracts, Ensuring compliance)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Order to Cash (responsible for Order Management, Touchless Support and Set-up, Dispute Management, Credit Management, ensuring invoices are correct and paid on time, Building strong relationships and creating partners (customers) for life, understand customer’s issues and drive resolution and improvements).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Sales Support (Manage existing customer portfolio of business, Manage customer relationship virtually, Analyst reports and identify, manage areas of underperformance, Champion the sales process with a strategic mindset, Manage key sales process steps as agreed with respective business, Data-driven sales recommendation)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b> Working proficiency in English - C1<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> At least two years’ experience in Customer Service field<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience of using SAP, SalesForce, Transporeon, would be a strong advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong Communication and Influencing skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previous experience in data Analytics &amp; Insights and the Digital environment would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated ability and commitment to build Customer Success<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Customer-Centric Design<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A good understanding of Commercial &amp; Economic Acumen and Value Chain methodology<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Attention to details when dealing with Data Management and high focus on Compliance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong relationship management skills; able to adapt approach to different audiences or circumstances<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability work across multiple external and internal touch points - being an effective team player and contributor<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilience: being open for a challenge and having ability to prioritize workload when under pressure from different stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Contracting &amp; Procurement TECHNOLOGY<\u002Fb>: Our mission is to Power Progress by converting technology into value through connected, world-class supply chains and empowered commercial teams. In practice, this means we collaborate closely with our partners in PTX to identify &amp; deliver new technologies for Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p> We are the commercial group for PTX, from strategy development to deal execution, and are fully embedded in their ways of working and natural teams. Commercially we help PTX adopt an investment mindset, and we ensure that our technology partnerships can manage technical and commercial risk to secure a competitive advantage for Shell. We are also CP’s subject matter experts in agreements with heavy Intellectual Property components, such as joint development agreements.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> It doesn’t stop there; CP Technology also makes sure that potential value turns into real value; whether that means ensuring Supply Chain Readiness with CP in the business for technology deployments across Shell assets or working with a commercial partner who can deliver for us and other customers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> All this means we need special people – <b>CP professionals<\u002Fb>, of course, but also flexible, commercially savvy, determined, collaborative, and open-minded with a passion for the Energy Transition. We are particularly active on PTX’s Energy Transition Moonshots – Electrification of Demand, Nature-Based Solutions, Hydrogen and Circularity &amp; BioProducts.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Analyst <\u002Fb><b>accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Technology market research support<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Exploit market research databases, academic literature, and internal\u002Fexternal subject matter experts; process, synthesize and integrate diverse inputs to support an accurate, insightful and in-depth analysis. In limited instances, employ primary research methodologies to inform high value technology investment\u002F deployment decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Outputs include: commercial solution search, market size\u002Fsegmentation, tech SWOT, trade study, trend\u002Fdriver analysis, taxonomy, competitive landscape, candidate screening, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Commercialization framing support <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p>Participate in decision framing sessions; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b>About the role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Customer Operations is in its journey to provide the best in market customer experience for our Customers and Business Partners in Shell. We create the great place for commercially minded individuals who thrive working with customers and who want to growth their experience in agile, digital and e-commerce initiatives.<br> We have a collaborative, flexible, dynamic and very supportive working culture; where every single one of us is determined to make a difference, to go the extra mile because it’s our job, every day, to make our customers’ experiences with Shell.<br> We believe in creating an inclusive culture and work environment where you can thrive, innovate and develop; but most of all, be yourself.<br> <br> Where You Fit In?<br> <b>Customer Success Specialist (CSS)<\u002Fb> is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers. This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfillment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. CSS provides Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><br> This role may focus on some or all of the accountabilities below, depending on operational requirements. Businesses serviced include but are not limited to: Global Commercial, Commercial Fleet and Retail. These activities cover all Customer levels including Key Accounts.<br> <br> <b>Order Management:<\u002Fb><br> Place, amend and orders, liaising with other service partners. Apply the appropriate freight charges and surcharges as required;<br> Provide change information of planned shipments to schedulers and scheduling admin team;<br> Manage Delivery Status – take ownership of delivery status enquiries and trouble-shooting; proactively tracking and Business Partners as required;Process Returned Product; Commercial Fleet: Block Cards within required SLA.<br> <br> <b>Credit: Management:<\u002Fb><br> Handle basic Customer credit enquiries.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Dispute Management:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Own the end to end Disputes process for Quantity, Pricing, Tax and Master Data Disputes. This includes logging of dispute, undertaking initial investigation and root cause analysis, liaising with key interfaces to resolve disputes. Close the loop with Customer on case outcome and confirm closure of case.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><b><br> Feedback and Issues:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Manage Customer complaints feedback and compliments. Liaise with resolution owners, and other Service Partners as required. Close the loop with customers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Touchless Support and Setup:<\u002Fb><br> Support and proactively encourage touchless uptake and utilization;<br> Act as first level support for system interface errors;<br> Act as a touchless setup lead in system-to-system setup with existing Customers. Work with Customer IT teams to resolve issues and manage internal processes.<br> <br> <b>Fraud Support:<\u002Fb><br> Monitor account and payment transaction activity to identify incidents of Fraud;<br> Support Fraud Managers with fraud case information requirements.<br> <br> <b>General Inquiries:<\u002Fb><br> Handle New Business - Receive request for information or quotation from potential new Customers and connect them to the appropriate contact within Shell.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Customer Language Proficiency (Hungarian) – C1<\u002Fli>\n       <li> English Language Proficiency – B2<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Previous experience in Customer service or operations<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience in Microsoft Office; <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Possess a strong Customer service ethic and ability to understand, meet and champion the Customer’s needs, while staying within the policies and procedures of Shell<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Able to demonstrate a continuous improvement mind-set<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Demonstrated communication and relationship building skills<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p> Demonstrate a willingness to be coached, showing an openness to feedback and performance improvement opportunities<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Trading &amp; Supply has a global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, LNG, chemicals, natural gas, electrical power, and CO2. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>This particular role will be supporting the Trading and Supply business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The key to becoming a successful Claims Specialist is to minimize the impact of cost claims and maximize the recovery of pursued claims. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We are looking for highly motivated people that are results-driven, work resiliently under pressure, and can demonstrate a passion for getting the best deal for Shell. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Commerciality, curiosity, attention to detail, and problems all come naturally to our ideal candidate. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>If you have a track record proving that you are a quick learner, a good communicator, and strong at building relationships with your stakeholders - then we are looking for you.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> In our team you will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Investigate the events of crude oil (or related products) claims and check the contractual agreement around costs. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Prepare product quantity, quality, and freight claims with third parties and stakeholders to maximize income while reducing costs paid out to prevent exposure for Shell.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure timely recovery of claims and correct reflection of financial implications in trading systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Co-operate with global stakeholders (such as Oil Traders, Commercial Operators, Inspection companies, Legal team, Product Quality team, etc). <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Negotiate claims to deliver value and retain profit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prepare monthly\u002Fquarterly reports and trend analyses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage and monitor the sanctions process according to Compliance requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively seek Continuous Improvement opportunities to save time and money and enable you to effectively shape your work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Take responsibility for safety, compliance, and audit readiness.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University Degree level or equivalent work experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exposure to working with global stakeholders and counterparties via remote communication.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of ability to identify the root cause of problems and generate\u002Fsupport creative solutions to those problems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Inquiring and strong analytical skills to understand every detail of an Oil deal, its execution, and the technicalities around the operation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Microsoft Excel skills at medium level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to read and interpret legal language would be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in the industry, particularly in Cash Management Analyst will perform cash management and bank account reconciliations. The role combines banking &amp; accounting elements. In this role, you will perform accounting activities and manage &amp; analyze the cash forecast for the business. Working in Cash Management will give you an opportunity to develop your career in Accounting, Finance &amp; Treasury areas while engaging in meaningful work that makes a direct bottom-line impact. We offer a diverse, supportive environment where you will grow personally and professionally as you learn from some of the most talented people in your field.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Principal <\u002Fb><b>Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Perform accounting activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Prepare cash flows and bank account reconciliations and clear open items identified.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Prepare cash flow forecasting and support liquidity management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Maintain financial data and reporting activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Other duties as assigned.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Skills &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Customer Operations is in its journey to provide the best in market customer experience for our Customers and Business Partners in Shell. We create the great place for commercially minded individuals who thrive working with customers and who want to growth their experience in agile, digital and e-commerce initiatives.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We have a collaborative, flexible, dynamic and very supportive working culture; where every single one of us is determined to make a difference, to go the extra mile because it’s our job, every day, to make our customers’ experiences with Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> We believe in creating an inclusive culture and work environment where you can thrive, innovate and develop; but most of all, be yourself<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where You Fit In?<\u002Fb><br> Customer Success Specialist (CSS) is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers. This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfilment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. CSS provides Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the Role?<\u002Fb><br> As a Customer Success Specialist, you will be accountable for a certain customer portfolio to take ownership, drive accountability, and demonstrate and communicate improvements for our customer journey.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role may focus on some or all the accountabilities below, depending on the respective business size and complexity:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Deal Management (accountable for Bid and Tender, Contract Management, Pricing, Master Data, Data Integrity Management, enforcing company’s policy and contracts, Ensuring compliance)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Order to Cash (responsible for Order Management, Touchless Support and Set-up, Dispute Management, Credit Management, ensuring invoices are correct and paid on time)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Sales Support (Manage existing customer portfolio of business, Manage customer relationship virtually, manage areas of underperformance, Manage key sales process steps as agreed with respective business, Data-driven sales recommendation)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What We Need from You?<\u002Fb><br> Critical to the success of this role is to demonstrate strong Customer Language Proficiency and experience in managing Customer Relationship and Customer Success.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Must have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Knowledge of Spanish (<b>min C1 level<\u002Fb>)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working proficiency in English<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong Communication and Influencing skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Attention to details when dealing with Data Management and high focus on Compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Nice to have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Knowledge of Italian (B2+) will be an asset.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previous experience in data Analytics &amp; more.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will be crucial in ensuring exceptional employee experience and by that helping employees feel supported and focused on their roles instead of HR concerns. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Would You like to provide end-to-end HR Operations support to employees and local HR executing complex Local HR Processes, in line with existing policies and procedures? We are looking for HR passionate who would like to join our HR Department as HR Advisor.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's a role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> HR Operations provides a range of services, focusing on ensuring that Shell employees and line managers get the best support and advice on HR related matters. Since 2015 the Krakow HR Operations team and HR teams in NL, UK, Norway, and Germany have been closely integrated, planning joint agendas and priorities based on both country and business needs. HR Operations supports all aspects of the employee lifecycle for employees located in Europe and Africa, international transfers included.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Management of end-to-end cases according to established ways of working, Using Salesforce tool to log queries and updates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Keeping customers updated on the status of open cases. Liaising with HR Business Partners, HR in the Country, Employees, and Line Managers, as required in order to resolve cases.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Dealing with third-party service providers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely escalation of complex queries to senior advisors, SME’s and policy teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing input for Knowledge Management within the team (including creation and ownership of documentation\u002F job aids).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sharing best practices within the team, striving for continual improvement in service delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Education requirement\u002Ffield of study:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Human Resources, Psychology, Sociology, Pedagogy, Business Administration.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for candidates who have very good knowledge and a good understanding of HR Model. Furthermore, we appreciate candidates who are empathetic and have an excellent mindset. Beyond that, we'd hope to see as many following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> 1-year work experience <\u002Fb>– previous experience in Shared Service, Call Centre. Service environment is an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> English (Good command, both written &amp; oral).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> German - B2\u002FC1<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exposure to an administration and \u002For services-oriented position preferable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in service excellence.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> SAP, Workday, or Salesforce experience is an advantage<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excel and analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where do you fit in? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The purpose of the role is to deliver end-to-end Finance &amp; Business scope for operated asset Pearl, as well as the relevant functions. The role is to be handled through close cooperation with the wider Qatar finance community (incl. Qatar Finance team onshore ). The scope of the role can evolve over time, to align with the business priorities. The role has strong interface to Qatar FiB advisors, as well as Qatar Finance LT members. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Specifics of the role include:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Prepare all inputs to the financial performance assessment process for the respective budget holders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide reliable and meaningful analysis of financial data to enable value adding MI <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Arrange regular meetings with the relevant budget holders, based on standard meeting agenda (actuals vs plan, forecast\u002Flatest estimates updates, treats &amp; opportunities etc.)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Challenge and agree proposal of forecast\u002Flatest estimates updates with the budget holders <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prepare annual Operating Plan in collaboration with budget holders and other members of Finance team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage cost allocation and master data (establish business need, create and maintain allocation set up with support from Controllers)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate effectively across an organization (support of Project Business Analyst, delivery of variance analysis for Group and MI reporting)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide input for relevant audits<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure compliance with the Shell Group Control Framework and relevant standards\u002Fguidelines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Actively participate in the back-up structure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> At least 5 <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Safety Data Sheet Authoring team is part of the Product Stewardship team that is responsible for the delivery of Hazard Communication documentation to various classes of business to support Shell's license to operate. The team manages more than 130,000 documents in more than 27 languages.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Safety Data Sheet (SDS) Author role is an important contributor to supporting Shell's overall business processes by authoring safety data sheets. New products and entry into new markets cannot occur without supporting documentation. This role is an individual contributor with no direct reports.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Has a leadership role in scheduling project work, resolving problems (defects), process improvements, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works within the rules and processes defined for the team to identify and assemble appropriate information within the system to produce accurate safety data sheets to meet the agreed deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Applies technical knowledge and regulatory rules to produce compliant hazard communication documentation. Is comfortable challenging presented information that does not appear to be consistent with current regulatory interpretations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages stakeholders within and outside the Product Stewardship team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identifies and promotes Continuous Improvement opportunities to eliminate waste where possible.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Is a primary lead for specific business areas or lines and coordinates support for that area. Makes safety data sheets available to the business, ensuring on-time product delivery to customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coaches and supports others in the team within a particular area of expertise<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can identify and work with the business or functional specialists to resolve data omissions or inconsistencies and share learning in the team from such issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Follows up on defect elimination efforts and schedules project work to ensure closure of actions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Experience and Qualifications required:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Individuals who are successful in this position often have exposure to relevant regulatory requirements and\u002For product chemistry concepts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in the sciences is strongly preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working knowledge of GHS\u002FCLP classification rules is highly desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> English Full professional proficiency is essential (B2\u002FC1 level Minimum)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong team working and interpersonal skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to detail &amp; analytical skills to follow-up issues and get to the root cause<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Confidence to work in a virtual environment and manage engagement across different levels of stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates with a background as industrial, refinery, or R&amp;D laboratory technicians have previously been successful in this role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n the role is to define, design and lead projects supporting business and functional changes as well as to coordinate or execute projects and change initiatives and interventions for drive organisational capability.<br> Working in Global Functions HR provides the opportunity to lead and contribute to transformational change agendas, build externally relevant and recognized functional HR experience and to develop HR skills in a truly global organisation spanning all of Shell's locations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n activities that enable smooth and timely operations. You will be part of a growing and dynamic global community of Brand professionals. <br> <br> The world is changing fast, and Shell is changing too – not only to keep up with the external pace, but also to anticipate and shape a different future. The new integrated Corporate Relations function will deliver value by supporting our strategy and sectoral approach and improving policy and advocacy outcomes. We will bring the outside in and secure and drive Shell’s reputation and values. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be best-in-class at achieving integrated outcomes through effective engagement and communication with external and internal stakeholders.<br> <br> Where you fit in:<br> As Shell pursues its ambitions towards net zero emissions, the role of Shell Brand team will be even more important in continuing to build trust, loyalty and credibility among our employees, customers, business partners and stakeholders. Communication specialists will serve a fundamental role as we develop and deliver award-winning, inspiring, and seamless creative projects for Shell businesses to communicate their business goals and activities.<br> <br> <b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><br> As the Brand Team Assistant, you will be accountable for day-to-day organizational and administrative tasks as assigned by the Global Brand Leadership Team (LT). You will also collaborate with wider Brand community on global, regional, and specific activities.<br> <\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n   <b>Your role will include: <\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Perform secretarial work and provide senior managers with day-to-day administrative support<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Schedule meetings and manage calendars<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Collating and filing expenses<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Performing general admin tasks as per the business need e.g., maintaining org charts and team documentation, maintaining documents in SharePoint<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assisting with travel booking esp. for complex itineraries<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Coordinating global and regional team meetings, training sessions, community calls etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Supporting global learning agenda esp. onboarding programme, maintaining documentation, and delivering training sessions <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Acting as a Focal Point and cross team collaboration with Real Estate, HSSE and IT colleagues <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <b>What we need from you?<\u002Fb>\n  <div>\n   <br> Leadership skills:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Learner Mindset – role model curiosity and reflection; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you’d like to learn more about Shell Oil and Gas business and prefer to work in a friendly multicultural environment, then role of Finance Analyst for Shell Italy is exactly what you’re looking for.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll be a member of Reporting &amp; Analysis team (6 people) and will report to Italy Senior Team Manager.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Role is accountable for statistical reporting to Italian governmental authorities and preparation of financial statements under IFRS and local Italian GAAP with the focus on operational excellence, business partnering and continuous improvements. You’ll need to build a deep knowledge of the outputs required and ways of working to deliver these, along with the tools and systems that are an integral enabler of the process. Work collaboratively with colleagues in Finance Operation and business, where operational excellence or data integrity impacts on the R&amp;A delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Report to Italian authorities and regulatory bodies;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accountable for preparation of Financial statements with the notes, under IFRS and Italian GAAP;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting audit of Group and Statutory accounts, promptly resolving audit findings and requests, being a Focal point for external auditors;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Month closing activities (fixed asset accounting, accruals, recharges and timewriting);<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Preparing data for Transfer pricing submission;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cross-functional cooperation with the business, partners and FO teams to ensure high quality financial statements and disclosures;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform regular balance sheet reconciliations;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute controls, ensure operational effectiveness of the controls within the <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell <b>Trading &amp; Supply<\u002Fb> has a global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, LNG, chemicals, natural gas, electrical power, and CO2.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This particular role will be supporting the <b>Trading and Supply Business<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the <b>Financial Crime Screening Team Lead<\u002Fb>, the FC Screening Analyst is part of the Financial Crime Operations team within the Global<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Financial Crime Team. The team undertakes Counterparty Screening – the checking of potentially adverse information relating to a counterparty which may impact our willingness to transact with them.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role will include: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Responsible for reviewing and assessing overnight screening and enhanced monitoring alerts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertake desktop research using a combination of publicly available and commercially licensed IT tools and data sources.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain records of daily screening activity for periodic Management Reporting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in monthly Quality Control activities as requested by the Team Lead.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the periodic review of process manuals to ensure these are up-to-date and fit-for-purpose.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> We are looking for candidates who have education to degree level or above (or equivalent work experience), in addition we'd hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Understanding of Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions, Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) &amp; Know Your Customer (KYC) policies\u002Fprocesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of high-risk jurisdictions and their associated risks, global sanctions requirements, the risks of dealing with Politically Exposed Persons, and corporate and complex entity structures including Special Purpose Vehicles, Trusts, and Funds, including identification of Ultimate Beneficial Owners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional experience in a screening role in a Financial Institution (Wholesale, Commercial\u002FCorporate, Investment Banking) and\u002For large Commodities or Trading House.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication in English - C1.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Intermediate level of computer literacy (MS Office suite products: Excel, PowerPoint and Word).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. The team undertakes periodic Counterparty review – the checking of potentially adverse information relating to a counterparty which may impact our willingness to transact with them.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <p> The Team Lead is responsible for the planning and organisation of the team’s work, enabling team members to execute their tasks efficiently and effectively while maintaining interfaces with key stakeholders and providing first-line of defence supervision and leadership for a team of 7 staff.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Manage a team of analysts who perform periodic and trigger-based Re-Reviews and counterparty outreach within agreed timeframes and quality standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Act as a subject matter expert and assist FC Due Diligence specialists on daily operational activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Support and drive continuous improvement and innovation initiatives as part of the overall Counterparty Lifecycle Management (CLCM) programme.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Implement T&amp;S KYC Standards, and associated policies and processes for Re-Reviews through subordinate procedures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Escalate concerns and provide an independent view and voice.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Ensure clear and frequent reporting of relevant management information to the leadership team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Understanding of Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions, Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) &amp; Know Your Customer (KYC) policies\u002Fprocesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Understanding of high-risk jurisdictions and their associated risks, global sanctions requirements, the risks of dealing with Politically Exposed Persons, and corporate and complex entity structures including SPVs, Trusts, and Funds, including identification of Ultimate Beneficial Owners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Professional experience in a counterparty onboarding role within a Financial Institution including ability to research information and undertake counterparty outreach to obtain required documentation for Counterparty Due Diligence.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication in English – C1.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Demonstrated ability to lead, collaborate and work effectively in a team as well as with stakeholders, taking into consideration customer needs and perspectives in day-to-day work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
