<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The <b>Supply Chain Procurement Specialist<\u002Fb> is a member of the Krakow based Contracting and Procurement (CP) Team supporting the Shell Asset in Trinidad and Tobago ensuring supply continuity by managing the execution of the Category Management &amp; Contracting Process (CMCP) including Contract Strategy, Tactics and Contract Management activities for the assigned portfolio<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><b>:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Value:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop commercially competitive contracting &amp; procurement strategies for assigned purchases which meets the Business Demand while taking into account potential implementation of Global Strategies at local\u002Fregional level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct tenders, evaluate bids &amp; drive negotiations with Suppliers in accordance to CMCP as an overall ‘guidance’.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive contract performance and spend reduction through contract management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver Third party spend savings. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Identify, develop &amp; implement supply chain improvement opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage one of Purchases and reduce\u002Frationalize the number of contracts\u002Fsuppliers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> HSSE: Ensure Supply Chain Strategy supports Goal Zero Aspiration through implementation of robust Contractor Safety Management practices and alignment to Shell’s personal and process safety Goal Zero focus areas. Implement Contractor HSSE practices in close liaison with Contract Managers\u002FHolders and Owners.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Business Interface: Proactively identify &amp; understand commercial\u002Fprocurement needs from Shell Business and collaboratively propose competitive solutions. Constructively challenge the Business Demand, Specification &amp;\u002For Procurement Practices in order to drive value and efficiency for the organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Supplier Interface: Manage Supplier Relationship effectively and collaboratively drive continuous performance improvement via relevant contract key metrics through contract management (Eg: HSSE, Operations, Cost). Constructively challenge the suppliers in terms of contract performance while building a strong network in the market, be fully aware of supplier developments and opportunities coming up in the market.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> People: Build effective working relationships with others and make a constructive contribution within the team. Provide support and guidance to other team members where possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Process: Ensure application of the E2E CMCP process, using commercial judgement, common sense and a simplification mind-set, understanding the difference between non-negotiable compliance elements (Safety, E&amp;C, Code of Conduct, Law) and CP operating practices, while always keeping enterprise business value in focus. Contract Template to establish competitive terms for the contracts<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> 2-5 years of professional experience, preferably in <b>Procurement <\u002Fb>area<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of the Sourcing and Contracting processes preferable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand the high-level<b> Requisition-to-Pay<\u002Fb> (RtP) policies, processes, systems<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communication skills &amp; capability of supporting stakeholders under challenging conditions in a multi-cultural environment, both on site as well as in virtual relationships.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong analytical skills and goal driven pragmatic issue resolution<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Open mind and creative thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Great stakeholder’s management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in spoken and written English<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Special Challenges:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The role supports Trinidad and Tobago, the resource is expected to work <b>mid shift <\u002Fb>(for premium salary) or have significant working hour overlap with Trinidad and Tobago work hours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Adapt rapidly to changing circumstances\u002Fpriorities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHO WE ARE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Leader in Energy Transition \u002FDecarbonization processes worldwide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leading Supply Chain function on Polish labor market with a potential to grow with multi opportunities to grow within our global\u002Finter-centers structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complex and business oriented projects for Experienced Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain Professionals and close- to-business project professionals, experienced in contracting, procurement and supply chain processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Opportunity to participate in Digital transformation and Data usage for Contract Procurement and Supply Chain E2E process;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Innovators, with whom you would work on Digital transformation;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business proximity and true impact of Contract Procurement and Supply Chain function is Shell; \u002FPeople, who have true impact on business, by developing acumen, proximity and driving real changes in Procurement and Supply Chain functions at Shell<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> HOW YOU START<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> “You are in a Safe Hands” our unique four phases onboarding program<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attractive relocation package available once relocating from another country;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Employee Referral Program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> HOW YOU WILL DEVELOP<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> By clear career path and Talent Management program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By learning and development programs to skill up within 11 Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain competencies;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By additional funds for trainings and certifications (ACCA, CIMA, CIPS, Lean Six Sigma);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By Contract Procurement and Supply Chain Mentoring program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> HOW WE WORK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Flexible working time (hybrid work);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complex medical care and individual life insurance;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Comfortable working environment: newly-built modern office with its own canteen, relax rooms, bike &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>International Mobility Tax Compliance (IMTC) function is responsible for a wide range of international tax activities for mobile employees in their annual tax return cycle. On an annual basis, approximately 13,000 tax returns are authorized for 9,000 employees in 67 countries. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Our main areas of responsibility include authorization of Shell internationally mobile employees for annual tax services, reporting compensation data to tax providers, timely oversight of required tax settlement payments due to Tax Authorities or Employees as well as recouping from the Tax Authorities and Employees when money is due to Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In this role you will be part of the Global International Mobility Tax Compliance Team that delivers world class performance in terms of timeliness, accuracy, and compliance in all countries that we operate in related to global expatriate compensation data reporting process. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>This position requires someone with the ability to work efficiently and effectively in a virtual and diverse environment, across a wide range of stakeholders in the various functions\u002Fline of businesses\u002Fcountries. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Execution of Authorizations for tax services and Global Data Collect processDrive Operational Excellence through elimination, standardization, simplification and automation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work in partnership with other Shell company teams outside of the IMTC organization including Employment Tax, International Mobility Policy, HR Operations, Payrolls, 3rd Party Tax Service Providers, and Finance Operations, ensuring high quality compliance and exceptional quality services<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate payroll data collection process for the multiple countries in a timely manner<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for executing operational controls<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in local and global projects aimed at ensuring operational excellence <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Coordinate all phases of the operations within the team to ensure efficient services delivery that meets all employee and stakeholders requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University degree preferably HR, Business Administration or Finance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3 years of professional experience working in International Mobility, Employment\u002FExpatriate Tax, Compensation, Payroll or Finance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work in a complex, global environment with multiple stakeholders (incl. 3rd Party vendors)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in cooperation with business stakeholders. Understanding in requirements related to E2E business processes and controls<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong written and verbal communication skills required to interact at all levels of the organization with confidence and professionalism<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in advanced use of Data Management software to support Data Analytics\u002FMining associated with the Global Data Collection process and reporting<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge and experience of relevant data privacy protocols and procedures, in accordance with regulations and compliance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong IT skills (Microsoft suite of products)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to deal with large and complex volumes of information. Conducting analysis and describe the results in a clear and concise manner<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Networking and relationship building skills, able to work closely with 3rd Party Tax Provider representatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexibility and resourcefulness with managing change, demonstrating initiative with regards to forward thinking and planning<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in standard capabilities of International Mobility Tax Tools, Assignment Pro or other similar SaaS applications is a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Employment Taxation (Expatriate Tax) experience preferred but not mandatory<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p>The world is changing fast and Shell is changing too – not only to keep up with the external pace, but also to anticipate and shape a different future. The new integrated Corporate Relations function will deliver value by supporting our strategy and sectoral approach and improving policy and advocacy outcomes. We will bring the outside in and secure and drive Shell’s reputation and values. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be best-in-class at achieving integrated outcomes through effective engagement and communication with external and internal stakeholders.<br> <br> <b>Where you fit in:<\u002Fb><br> As Shell pursues its ambitions towards net zero emissions, the role of the Shell brand will be even more important in continuing to build trust, loyalty and credibility among our employees, customers, business partners and stakeholders. Design and communication specialists will serve a fundamental role as we develop and deliver award-winning, inspiring and seamless creative projects for Shell businesses to communicate their business goals and activities. You will be part of Creative Solutions, an in-house creative global enterprise dedicated to one customer: Shell. Creative Solutions is Shell’s go-to team for integrated content creation, experiential and sponsorship activation. We are responsible for producing a wide range of creative content, campaigns and events – from delivering innovative virtual experiences to producing world-class, fully integrated campaigns combining film, digital, social, design and print assets. <br> <br> <b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> As the CSPM Corporate Reports, <b>you will manage the end-to-end process for design and production of Shell’s corporate reports and shareholder mailing including the Annual Report, Sustainability Report and Tax Contribution Report, amongst others<\u002Fb>. You will be responsible for the sound planning, organisation and delivery of these publications which are distributed annually to investors, shareholders, government representatives, NGOs, media and employees. You get to lead the design and production management of Shell’s corporate reports, a suite of high-profile publications which are distributed to key stakeholders. You will be responsible for delivering creative and cost-effective reports which build and leverage Shell’s single most valuable asset, the Shell Brand. You will be part of a dynamic global community of creative stewards.<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b><br> Your role will include:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the end-to-end project management of the reports’ design and production process, including setting budgets, timelines, tasks and task owners. Ongoing tracking to identify any issues and implement mitigation measures to ensure successful delivery against the project plan; maintain comprehensive project documentation;<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> • Manage suppliers for design, digital, layout, proof-reading, print and distribution. Monitor their delivery to secure the best value, service standards and output for Shell; • Bring creativity to the design process and offer stylistic recommendations in areas such as photography and graphics, while ensuring compliance with brand, accessibility and visual identity guidelines;\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Build relationship with senior stakeholders including in Legal, Finance, Investor Relations, Editorial and Corporate Relations. Liaising with the stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle for planning, progress updates, approval processes and delivery;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Following each reporting cycle, measure the project’s effectiveness including against external benchmarks. Identify best practices, insights and improvements for future implementation.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Support other, non-reports creative design projects such as design for print, digital, presentations and integrated campaigns.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <br> \n   <b> What we need from you:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Learner Mindset – role model curiosity and reflection; encourage people to learn from mistakes and successes;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maximise performance – integrate and collaborate across boundaries to maximise commercial value for Shell as a whole.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Significant<b> project management experience<\u002Fb><b>gained in-house or within a large, fast-paced agency or creative environment,<\u002Fb> with a strong track record in design, digital and marketing communications;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Knowledge of design and production processes for <b>corporate publications<\u002Fb> or similar materials;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong stakeholder management skills across all levels and supplier management such as design and creative agencies;<\u002Fli>\n    <li><b>Budget management<\u002Fb> and the ability to drive the best value and achieve cost savings;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Excellent planning and organisational skills including being able to prioritise multiple tasks and deadlines during peak periods in the reporting cycle.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Description\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p><b> The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> If you are interested in providing high-quality and insightful financial analysis and would like to work for the industry-leading businesses this role is for you. As a Senior Planning and Appraisal analyst you will work with colleagues in the business and Finance to produce the relevant insights that supports the business in their decision-making. This position will support planning; forecasting and appraisal scope. Planning and Appraisal provide high exposure to Shell business leaders giving opportunities to work on important business problems and in personal development.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Where do you fit in?<\u002Fp>\n      <p><br> This is an individual contributor role in a team supporting country or global\u002Fregional businesses. The team is part of the wider Upstream; Integrated Gas and Renewable Energy Solutions organisation.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> What’s the role?<\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <ul>\n        <li><br> Support the business decision making (operational and strategic)<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Collaborate effectively across multiple assets\u002Fentities and functions to develop a credible annual business plan, including challenging inputs and ranking opportunities<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Work with and challenge assets\u002Fentities to deliver fit for purpose quarterly latest estimates, focused on value\u002Frisk. Support performance appraisal materials<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Perform analysis of monthly and quarterly financial results, gaining understanding of business performance and challenging where appropriate (e.g. burn rates, one-offs)<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Formulate and effectively communicate concise performance insights to senior leaders (monthly MI), gaining respect through your authenticity and ability to speak up and challenge where appropriate<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Provide ad-hoc deep dive analysis performance that utilises the individuals understanding of the interactions of core financial indicators and their relationship to the underlying business<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Coordinate the delivery of complex sets of Planning and Appraisal products in a matrix environment and implementing opportunities to standardise and optimise delivery.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Build a funnel of technical automation solutions that will drive Planning and Appraisal efficiency and lead the resulting projects to ensure their successful implementation.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Working with most confidential, market-sensitive data is an important feature of this role.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Very wide range and seniority of planning and appraisal activities, that are delivered in the centre gives an opportunity for many career paths and learning most of Shell global businesses.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <div>\n       <ul>\n        <li><br> University degree in a finance related discipline<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Relevant experience and a proven track record in business performance management<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Mindset to drive truly global standards in a customer centric way<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Technical capabilities in automation and data management or the aptitude to develop these skills<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Professional qualification such as CIMA or ACCA - or recent progress to obtaining your qualification would be an asset.<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Self-starter with a track record of performance and proven ability to deliver quality results under significant time pressure and to tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Strong interpersonal &amp; leadership skills with personal confidence to quickly build credibility, respect and rapport<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Strong communication skills, and ability to complex raw data into understandable key messages &amp; insights<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Strong analytical and numerical skills<\u002Fli>\n        <li>Able to work across organisational boundaries with a diverse group of colleagues and stakeholders at multiple levels in the organization<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are currently looking for an Assistant Investigator to join our global team of Shell Internal Audit and Investigations (SIAI).<br> In Shell Internal Audit and Investigations (SIAI) we work with all businesses in all parts of the world. We aim to deliver independent, courageous and actionable insights from our audits and investigations and support learning and improvement at all levels of Shell. By doing so, we support sustainable delivery of Shell’s strategic goals: being a World Class Investment Case, upholding a strong Societal License to Operate and Thriving in the Energy Transition.<br> The Shell Global Helpline and SIAI’s integrity investigations unit is a cornerstone of Shell's ethical culture, providing a trusted safe space for the raising of concerns and a dedicated team investigations team on potential Code of Conduct violations, which is relied upon respected and supported by leadership and Board level.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Key dimensions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Assist Lead Investigators with investigation Planning activities, including:<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Preparation of investigation Terms of Reference.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Obtaining additional information on allegations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Creation of investigation approach, strategy and planning.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Preliminary investigation enquiries and drafting Notes to File.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Creating an evidence repository for every investigation<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assist Lead Investigators with the Execution of investigations, including:<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Identifying and retrieving sources of evidence including: HR records, Travel and Expense records, Ethics &amp; Compliance records, ERP\u002FFinancial records, Contracting and Procurement records.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Forensic IT: Perform searches of electronic data using Forensic search tools (e.g. FTK) to identify red flags for Lead Investigator review. Forensic imaging of assets (laptops, phones, devices). Preparing reports out based on findings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Data Analysis: Review output from SIAI Data Analytics experts to identify red flags for Lead Investigator review.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertaking advanced due diligence screening\u002Fbackground checks using public domain data (e.g. corporate records searches etc).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Interviews: assist with the interviewing of witnesses\u002Fsubjects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing periodic status updates to stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Preparation of Investigation Report for Lead Investigator write-up.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Assist Lead Investigators with investigation Reporting activities, including:<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Undertaking Report Quality Control Reviews according to a checklist.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinating closeout meetings with stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prepare investigation summaries to support learnings from incidents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Updating and completing information in BID’s case management systems (CMS and Global Helpline) throughout the investigation and on closing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Educated to degree level, preferably in a relevant discipline such as Finance, Legal, Criminology, IT Forensics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High degree of integrity and reliability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong people skills to be highly credible in dealing with whistleblowers and witnesses<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent data analysis skills and persistence combined with objectivity, balance and excellent judgement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Courage in handling challenging situations and in assessing ethical and moral dilemmas<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in English, including high quality writing skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The Group Screening Service<\u002Fb> (GSS) team provides a third-party screening service to the Shell Group to assess counterparty risks related to money laundering, trade controls including terrorist financing or other related financial crimes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Group Screening Service Operational Excellence (GSS OE) Team drives continuous improvement agenda in GSS by implementing new solutions and streamlining processes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> GSS OE Specialist<\u002Fb> would be responsible for delivery of projects assigned to him and assuring these bring expected benefits and value for GSS.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Ensures data\u002Fdocument management consistency which includes document management of projects, rigorously maintaining control and traceability of the documentation from project initiation throughout to completion for a portfolio of small to medium sized projects of low to moderate complexity, but extends to working with the GSS operational teams to understand and provide data management solutions and advise to these teams.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Through the application of a risk-based mindset to ensure that a fully design effective control framework is maintained, across both GSS Standard and GSS Enhanced screening controls, including the deployment of controls.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contributing to change management, deploy initiatives, implementation of Data\u002FDocument Control procedures and operationalizing systems, processes and work instructions as per the Plan.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work as the secondary\u002Fsupporting interface into IT organization to identify, prioritize and provide ongoing input into IT projects and programms.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure that high quality standards are maintained in the update of global controls documentation which is key to ensuring ongoing operational effectiveness of the control framework.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to drive forward continuous improvement initiatives, and partner with key stakeholders in transforming control frameworks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the Team Manager and wider team on any ad-hoc projects and initiatives that may arise.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supports enhancing reporting, metrics and quality assurance including assessing and plan for how to use analytics to improve the service in the future.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Professional experience in a sanctions screening in a risk, fraud, compliance or analytical role working in a Medium to Large organization for a minimum of 2 years<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Third level qualification Legal, Finance or Business related<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in projects delivery which included substantive cooperation with IT organization and multiple business stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Skills\u002FKnowledge<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Process and Data Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fast a need.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand the legislation, such as Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC, European Union, etc, surrounding sanctions imposed on certain countries. Ability to interpret government regulations with a good understanding of technical requirements. Knowledge of “Know Your Customer” requirements would be beneficial. Good understanding of the banks payment systems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business Partnering<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent written and verbal communication in English<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficient IT skills. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We currently have an opening for Category Specialist to join our Operations Excellence Europe team in SBO Krakow. If you are looking for exciting and meaningful opportunities in a global company at the forefront of the energy business and climate debate read on.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of this role will be to manage assigned categories for the Convenience Retail UK business that sources goods and services across a broad spectrum of fast-moving consumer goods categories.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role requires best-in-class category management skills with the effective use of the <b>4Ps<\u002Fb> - <b>P<\u002Fb>roduct, <b>P<\u002Fb>lace, <b>P<\u002Fb>ricing &amp; <b>P<\u002Fb>romotions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Pivotal to the role will be interaction with fast-moving consumer goods suppliers, negotiating then managing the execution of annual Joint Business Plans.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position holder will support the broader Category Management Team to drive overall sales and profit.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> It requires to define, shape, manage and monitor their categories; working with internal and external stakeholders to optimize an ever-evolving offer whilst delivering against business targets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Category Specialist must have strong analytical skills combined with stakeholder management skills, a process driven mindset and close attention to detail and accuracy. There are regular timelines that he\u002Fshe will need to deliver activities against to ensure that incremental sales, revenue, or cost saving efficiencies can be activated across the UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Effective end to end process management of building a product range<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analysis of new product introductions and promotions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accurate maintenance of Category database<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Building strong working relationships with internal departments and external suppliers (including occasional business trips)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collating information to aid in the communication of Category strategies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Reviewing market information to ensure trading is accurate and competitive<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting key promotional activity within the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the Category Manager to develop and implement range reviews for assigned categories and seasonal activations to drive incremental sales and profit<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Commercial acumen and experience of using a PC with a thorough knowledge of MS software<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analytical skills demonstrable across different tools with high attention to detail and accuracy<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication, time management and organizational skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborative team approach to work across multiple external and internal touch points<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A reliable, calm, and focused attitude to work with the ability to meet deadlines against changing priorities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A result driven mindset to support delivery of stretching business targets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Insights orientated with a rounded understanding of the dynamics of the shopper and the retail landscape<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Positive self-starter able to act as an advocate for change, seeking constant business or process improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Delivery Assurance Analyst is the first contact with drivers, hauliers, Customer Service Center and scheduling teams to perform amendments to the schedule during its execution. In addition to managing customer enquiries and processing urgent orders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <p><b> Please be aware that this is a role in the morning, afternoon, and night shift system.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Please be aware that on this position you can work fully remotely!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li><p> Manage deviation from schedule i.e. process in GSAP any post schedule amendments to the shift: Left on board, plant\u002Fdepot change, load quantity changes, compartment changes, trip sequence change, vehicle change, orders scheduled not delivered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n        <li><p> Receive urgent order requests and create urgent orders within the framework of delivery promise. Provide feedback of changes to planned shipments to schedulers and scheduling admin team, particularly to VMI customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n        <li><p> Handle customer enquiries to change\u002Famend orders, evaluate the real need and feasibility for scheduling changes, and liaise with the scheduling team where appropriate. Ensure any Special Instructions noted on the orders have been processed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n        <li><p> Initiate surcharges for Left on Board and urgent orders to the customers. Investigate and resolve customer complaints. Ensure documentation and filing is accurate, up to date, and accessible.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n       <p><\u002Fp>\n       <p><b> Special Challenges:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n       <ul>\n        <li><p> Assess\u002Fhandle unplanned issues arising from delivery\u002Fsystem constraints.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n        <li><p><b> Continuously rotating shift system to provide 24-hour support ( 3 x 8 hr shifts per 24 hrs). <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>If you are looking for exciting and meaningful opportunities for strong communicators in a global company at the forefront of the energy business and climate debate read on.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The world is changing fast and Shell is changing, too – not only to keep up with developments – but to anticipate and shape a better future. Shell’s newly integrated global Corporate Relations function brings together professional communicators, brand experts, government relations professionals and specialists in non-technical risk and social performance to work with commercial and technical colleagues and deliver Shell’s business strategy. The CR team will bring external analysis and perspectives to business decisions, communicate Shell to the world and drive Shell’s brand and reputation. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be the best at achieving successful integrated outcomes for the business through effective engagement and communication with stakeholders and audiences.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Where you fit in:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The newly created CR Coordinator CPE position is based in Krakow, Poland where a growing communications community provides Shell’s global businesses with solutions in internal\u002Fexternal communications, content development and campaigning, brand and reputation management, commercial deal-making support, cutting-edge creative solutions and professional operations at the nerve centre of the Function.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will support all end users to enable Shell employees to be compliant with the Group Standards and Guidelines on Trade Association participation. Strong support is required in implementing consistent ways of working and best practices across the Group, facilitating effective use of Code of Conduct Register (CoCR) Trada Association (TA) Module to support compliance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position reports to the SSCR Team Lead Operations in Krakow.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> What is the role?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> System Administrator for CoCR – TA Module:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Quality check of TA entries to assure compliance and accurate use of new functionality;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain TA dropdown and masterlists: e.g., merging organisations in case of duplicates, adjusting newly created TA names to the agreed standard, etc;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close out of scope entries and raising awareness via trainings and proactive communication;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support enhancement items for the CoCR, including testing (implemented using Agile Project Management);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> TA roll-out support:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provide regular CoCR registration data downloads, compare existing entries to roll-out lists. When necessary, chase those who have not yet registered by email;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Check whether ‘Political Payment Letters’ for organisations from the roll-outs are on file and valid; provide feedback to country coordinators and TA analysts;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Run financial reports and make a cross check with payment data from CoCR registrations;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Trade Association Module One Stop Shop:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Act as a one-stop shop mailbox for any TA-related queries. Answer, troubleshoot or redirect submitters to appropriate people\u002Fresources for further guidance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver reports and documentation for audits<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide necessary support to Trade Association Country Coordinators (including Power BI access management and training).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> What we need from you?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong<b> Analytical <\u002Fb>and <b>organizational skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing database with an <b>eye on detail<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to <b>identify problems and decide on the best solution<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to <b>effectively communicate with a wide range of people in different ways<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to work independently<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to <b>clarify complex information<\u002Fb>, both written and verbal<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Integrative working style; <b>ability to work in cross-functional, multi-cultural teams<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A learner mindset; being a role model of curiosity and reflection and encouraging people to learn from their mistakes and successes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. materials from planning phase through to execution of the work order, in a challenging, commercial and technical environment, providing support to the asset business through an high-level of activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Scope of the role is to improve, manage and execute relevant aspects of Production Inventory, Contract Management, Warehouse and Vendor Management, partake in planning and scheduling sessions &amp; enable work order execution, reacting to Corrective and Preventative maintenance execution requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Establish efficient and ensure alignment with function and facility priorities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Being informed and supporting of facility priorities via various modes of information (e.g. morning reports)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coaching both peers and business in all matters of material supply<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engaging with warehouse\u002Fstores personnel (on and Team manager, Latin America will have an opportunity to lead a team of motivated Credit professionals, giving a chance to utilize his\u002Fher leadership skills, as well as to put financial knowledge and commercial aspect into practice, as the role requires constant contact with key finance\u002Fbusiness stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> We support Mexican Market so working hours are between 14:00 PM till 22:30 PM.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Main <\u002Fb><b>responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Leading a team of up to10 analysts and specialists, including development, performance appraisal, workload management, and support in daily operational matters.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Overseeing daily operations for 4 key credit processes: Debt Collection, Cash Application and, Allocation, Risk Assessment, and Debt Recovery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Managing relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, including the Credit team onshore, Sales, and Customer Operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Participating in local and global projects, connected to CI initiatives\u002Fprocess improvement, as well as being responsible for the compliance and controls framework in the managed operational unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Experience &amp; portfolio strategy for <b><i>Commercial Road Transport<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>and Fleet business in specific country.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of this role is to convert local market insights into effective pricing management and deliver value, entrench, and grow the brand to strike a balance between volume and value delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Customer Success Specialist (CSS) is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship, and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers. This job holds accountable for delivering pricing management of customer commercial conditions and <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role requires pricing customer support from contract and account set-up to order and payment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> customer service in Czech or Slovak<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Follow price policies and implement price changes resulting from national and international oil price movements, other relevant local market price developments or competitive actions as well as other cost factors,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close coordination with local Pricing, Retail and Sales to create, validate and maintain local pricing insights with the market environment (e.g., Nature Based solution, Mobility offer).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Recommend and lead operational implementation of price strategies &amp; tactics on the assigned country\u002Fcluster.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure pricing compliance and store approval documentation in the system for audit and control accuracy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute control reports and follow up on areas of concern (like list price changes, bonus payment).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support supervisors in people-related matters such as introduce new joiners, coach junior team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> Czech or Slovak (min. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>A great introduction to one of the world’s largest commodity trading businesses – you’ll sharpen your accounting standards expertise, learn about valuation techniques and become a valued business partner to diverse decision-makers all over the world.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> What’s the role?<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading consists of several businesses (Gas, Power and Emissions; Crude; Products; LNG). The role will focus on Gas, enabling you to develop real expertise.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SCOPE:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Preparing IFRS-compliant derivatives accounting entries by applying accounting rules, to fair value and then report future commodity transactions..<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Production of the associated analysis, commentary and year-end disclosures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Operating important controls when preparing the results and do first line analysis of key drivers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Over time you will gain understanding of the key IFRS accounting principles underpinning derivatives.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Learning that there is a material differences between Market Risk valuations (Fair economic value) and the accounting valuation – that’s why it’s vital that you can forge effective working relationships with Market Risk teams;<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Outside the closing periods you will support Europe Gas Settlement team in daily billing activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n    REQUIREMENTS:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A qualified accountant (5 to 6 years), you’ve acquired good finance experience (including accounting &amp; reporting) either in a commodity trading environment or with an accounting practice or other large corporate.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Candidates with prior derivative accounting experience would be at an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong knowledge of MS Excel<\u002Fli>\n    <li>You should be comfortable working with different systems and prior experience with the trading system such as Aligne, Endur, or DEX will be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Able to link an underlying process and set of activities to broader accounting concepts and able to understand “why” activities are needed; not just the “what”<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Able to apply some judgement and make practical recommendations taking into account (amongst other factors), data availability, systems, time etc<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong communications skills including the ability to relate concepts clearly when dealing with senior stakeholders and management<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Able to work as part of a virtual global team, bringing a positive and proactive approach to managing and solving problems.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>The role needs good attention to detail and an enquiring mindset; being on alert for new trades, for changes in the way they are entered and continually asking “does this make sense”.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> OTHER:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Roles supporting UK, to follow UK timezones. Outside of period close, there may be more flexibility to work local hours<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This a key role in the Integrated Jet (IJ) team, responsible for the portfolio of airports in DACH (Germany, Austria &amp; Switzerland) and a great entry point into the Shell Aviation commercial (sales &amp; airport optimization) organization. The role provides the opportunity to gain expertise in key aspects of Airport optimization (including tendering, forecasting, and relationships with airport authorities), with extensive exposure to Trading&amp;Supply (T&amp;S) and to the Global Aviation organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Shell Aviation<\u002Fb> is a dynamic business in the Downstream Secorts&amp;Decarbonisation (S&amp;D) portfolio that is responsible for both fuel and lubricants sales. Every 12 seconds we fuel an aircraft, either through our own into-plane operations or via joint-venture operations. As we move forward in the energy transition Shell Aviation (SAV) will continue to play an important role in supporting our customers to decarbonize the aviation sector using Sustainable Aviation Fuels &amp; Carbon Offsets in the short and mid-term, and hydrogen in the long term. It is an exciting time to join the team as we support our customers to grow back stronger and greener in the post-pandemic recovery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountability:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage engagement activities with key external stakeholders especially; airport authorities, third-party suppliers such as into-plane service providers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage multiple interfaces and balance different commercial perspectives. Interfaces include Sales, Operations, T&amp;S, Finance, Airport Authorities, and potential partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively manage &amp; grow the Profit&amp;Loss Statement (P&amp;L) of a portfolio of DACH airports, increasing end to end profitability through optimizing customer mix, supply chain, and operating costs in local airports in close collaboration with T&amp;S.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Set margin aspirations and rock bottom prices, and own the short term customer pipeline at all DACH airports.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide monthly\u002Fin-month demand volume forecasts for Jet A1 to supply and pricing teams by obtaining data from Airports, Airlines, and from the news.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Experience and Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Fluent German&amp;English for both spoken and written communication.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective stakeholder management, communication, and presentation skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to learn quickly, analyze problems\u002Fsituations and suggest practical solutions with a focus on optimization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A degree-level qualification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The<b>Financial Accounting and Reporting Specialist <\u002Fb>will focus on operational excellence in the delivery of its process responsibilities. They will build a deep knowledge of the outputs required and ways of working to deliver these, along with the tools and systems that are an integral enabler of the process. They will work collaboratively with colleagues in R&amp;A and their peers from other processes where operational excellence or data integrity impacts on the R&amp;A delivery. The role will have a mix of deliverables between transactional accounting and standard reporting. Ensuring business transactions are accounted either automatically or manually in line with the Standard Global Processes as well as Shell and External accounting guidelines or to build accounted numbers into standard reports. This could be through automation of systems or manual interventions.<br> <br> <b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Perform standard accounting activities accurately and in line with timetable (General ledgeraccounting activity)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the preparation and submission of standard internal\u002Fexternal reporting requirements in line with group timelines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaboration with other R&amp;A colleagues and other processes to ensure timelyclosure of ledger<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performing an analysis role inbalance sheet reconciliationsensuring all control requirements met on a timely basis<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Operating all SOX and internal controls in line with Work Instructions and the Group controls framework<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support R&amp;A special projects &amp; timely and effective responses to special data\u002Fproject requests<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong team-working across the process area is essential<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cooperation with multiple stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Master’s Degree in the following areas: Finance\u002FAccounting\u002FEconomics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Min 3 years of experience in a relevant accounting environment (GL\u002FRTR or Audit)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Very good knowledge of Excel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> ACCA or CIMA certification would be a strong asset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>As a<b> Senior Analyst Credit Assessment<\u002Fb>, you will be Responsible for the efficient and effective operational management of credit risk according to policy and direction from credit committees. You will be also responsible for providing authorized approval for the release of credit blocked orders and taking credit decisions. Moreover, Actively support the Regional Credit Manager and participate in the virtual regional credit teams.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your main accountabilities would be:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for the efficient and effective management of credit risk according to Downstream Credit Manual (DCM) and direction from the credit committee.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for providing authorized approval for release of credit blocked orders and taking credit decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing an assessment of a customer's credit risk and recommending terms of credit<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Performing detailed financial analysis based on customer financial statements for development of a risk profile of a customer<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analyzing the overall credit exposure<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing authorized approval for continuing deliveries to customers in case of overdue or credit limit exceeding<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Negotiating and managing securities necessary to support higher-risk exposures based on a risk-reward approach<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resolving credit enquiries and complaints from customers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing complex customers’ portfolio<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communicating with internal and external customers in a professional, assertive, and efficient manner<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ownership &amp; maintenance of 3rd party contracts in support of credit management activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to provide support in Credit-related matters to countries within the Cluster.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3 years of experience in credit management with specific experience in credit and balance sheet analysis<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sound understanding of financial processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have experience in a multi-national company or bank environment – preferably in a Shared Services environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exhibits excellent English communications skills (written and oral)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Exhibits excellent Italian communications skills (written and oral)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of controls framework<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work under high pressure and in a rapidly changing environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong analytical skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong problem-solving skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Job Purpose: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This job sits within the Deal Management Journey forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfilment Cycle. The role provides support to the Mobility business related to day to day operation in<b>Contract Management <\u002Fb>area.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The job supports delivery of a Customer Value Proposition that sets Shell apart from its competitors. The CSS Deal Management supports Account Managers in on-boarding Customers to Shell and delivering all relevant changes to the customer agreement throughout the contract life-cycle. The CSS Deal Management owns pricing and the contract set up, amendment and management process. This role makes sure Customers find it easy to do business with Shell by providing a best-in-market Customer experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Contract Management: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Work with Account Managers to provide pre-offer, offer and contract management support for standard and non-standard contract set up and maintenance, in compliance with the Play Book<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute contract legal and fiscal requirements, working with local legal focals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Follow-up directly with customers on missing contract documentation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure contracts are signed and stored in line with local country requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Review contract performance as part of SCM process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Own contract documentation archiving and termination of customer contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support preparing for tender bids<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Pricing: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Set up and maintain end to end pricing data, including confirming pricing, managing price increases and changes, implementing rebates and charge backs, investment deals, invoice accuracy, and resolving pricing related errors and disputes (also covers Distributor DFOA Customers)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Trouble Shooting: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide “One Team” support for Sales in owning and resolving all Deal Making issue resolution. Work to uncover issue root cause of issues and implement sustainable fixes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as resolution owner of Customer complaints. Feedback outcomes to COS Order to Cash colleagues who will communicate with customers<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Master Data Set Up &amp; Amend: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Maintain Sales Hierarchy, contract registers and banding adherence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Set up and amend Customer master data<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as Resolution Owner for Master Data Disputes. Liaise with key interface, business partners and\u002For Customers to resolve them and perform invoice adjustment (in consultation with line manager and within the authorisations as applicable)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Data Integrity Management: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Maintain master data integrity. Review DQS reports, correct any data errors and track performance against SLA<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Touchless Setup: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Act as a touchless setup lead in system-to-system setup with new Customers (BCI, EID, OCR, EDI). Work with Customer IT teams to resolve issues and manage internal processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Job Knowledge, Skills &amp; Experience: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Language: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>German - C1<\u002Fli>\n   <li> English Language Proficiency – B2<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Other Skills &amp; Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelor degree preferred (Business related major) or equivalent experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previous experience in Customer Operations or Mobility business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in Microsoft Office; GSAP experience preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Attention to details, analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Possess a strong Customer service ethic and ability to understand, meet and champion the Customer’s needs, while staying within the policies and procedures of Shell<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand Shell’s Play Book and customer value proposition<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to demonstrate a continuous improvement mind-set<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated communication and relationship building skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrate a willingness to be coached, showing an openness to feedback and performance improvement opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Purpose:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> As Financial Controller, you’ll play a key role in the management of a Legal Entity\u002Fventure by ensuring quality financial reporting and compliance and delivering insightful analysis to support performance management of the business. You’ll work collaboratively with colleagues in Reporting and Analysis (R&amp;A) alongside business and functional stakeholders to ensure processes are executed efficiently and to a high standard and support continual improvement agenda. If you have strong accounting, process and financial controls background and are keen to develop further in a dynamic environment, this could be the opportunity to make your mark in the energy industry:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Oversee period close ensuring financial statements are materially accurate prior to submission to group<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Accountable for timely, high quality internal and external reporting, including Group Reporting submissions, Management Information, Fixed assets, Statutory + ad hoc reporting<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Review investment proposals, determine accounting impact and translate into clear accounting notes<\u002Fli>\n    <li>GFRM \u002F IFRS subject matter expert<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensure activities are conducted in line with Shell frameworks and policies, as well as external and local legislation<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensure operational and design effectiveness of the controls within areas of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Support performance management discussions, delivering and presenting insightful analysis to key stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Take lead in managing stakeholder relationships including tax, legal, finance, business and IT<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Support audits including statutory, joint venture partner and Shell internal audits<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Actively contribute to improvement agenda, by identifying potential process improvements and supporting\u002Fleading process improvement projects<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> The successful candidate should have the following experience and skills:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Have a strong background in financial accounting, reporting and controls with 5+ years’ experience in relevant roles<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Have a proven ability to execute processes whilst ensuring appropriate compliance to at all levels in the Organisation<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Be able to translate complex data into insightful analysis, understandable to both financial and non-financial stakeholders;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Independently manage workload and prioritise appropriately to meet deadlines<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Continuous Improvement mind set and openness to embrace change;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong communication and stakeholder management skills and able to achieve results through influencing others;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to work in a rapidly changing and demanding environment<\u002Fli>\n    <li>An accounting degree or relevant professional qualification (ACCA\u002FCIMA)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>As HR - International Mobility Advisor you will be the central point of contact to the Shell employees from all over the Globe, who are undertaking international assignments. This role combines project management role and delivery of exceptional employee experience for an end-to-end International Mobility Polices and Process. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will also be responsible for connecting with line managers, country HR, regional mobility teams and mobility service providers to ensure timely execution and success transfer into location with full country compliance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If You consider HR as a career path and you have strong communication skills, positive attitude, an open mind and you like working with people, this role could be your chance to start your career in <b>HR Operations!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you are experienced in HR operations, business HR, customer service or if you have knowledge about international relocation, you should also consider joining our team!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage transfer as a project by holding accountability for and coordinating all transfer activities as per the process &amp; policy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide policy advice or\u002Fand clarify policy-related questions from the employee and the relocation advisor (and other parties, if necessary, e.g. line managers, business HR).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Focus on high-quality customer service in each aspect of the transfer process by applying Exceptional Employee Excellence standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Cooperate closely with our vendors in making sure all applicable relocation services are delivered in a timely manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate the communication &amp; tasks of all relevant parties in the transfer process to deliver their service correctly &amp; timely.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> English language – C1<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Strong application<\u002Fb> of acquired knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques in managing end-to-end transfer cases.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Fast learner<\u002Fb>- process understanding, determine what fits best for employee’s transfer scenario including global and local policies and external circumstances.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Process ownership<\u002Fb> - managing day-to-day activities while being involved in regional activities\u002Fworkstreams, personal development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Following the right ways of working<\u002Fb> without putting employees and company at legal business risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Curiosity<\u002Fb> about personal development within the company<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Motivated<\u002Fb> to deliver Exceptional Employee Experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Experience<\u002Fb> in HR area will be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>The<b>Finance Analyst<\u002Fb>will focus on operational excellence in the delivery of its process responsibilities. They will build a deep knowledge of the outputs required and ways of working to deliver these, along with the tools and systems that are an integral enabler of the process. They will work collaboratively with colleagues in R&amp;A and their peers from other processes where operational excellence or data integrity impacts on the R&amp;A delivery.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The role will have a mix of deliverables between <b>transactional accounting<\u002Fb> and <b>standard reporting<\u002Fb>. Ensuring business transactions are accounted either automatically or manually in line with the Standard Global Processes as well as Shell and External accounting guidelines or to build accounted numbers into standard reports. This could be through automation of systems or manual interventions.<br> <br> <b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Perform standard accounting activities accurately and in line with timetable (<b>General ledger <\u002Fb>accounting activity)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the preparation and submission of standard internal\u002Fexternal reporting requirements in line with group timelines<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Collaboration with other R&amp;A colleagues and other processes to ensure timely<b>closure of ledger<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <li> Performing an analysis role in<b>balance sheet reconciliations<\u002Fb>ensuring all control requirements met on a timely basis<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Operating all SOX and internal controls in line with Work Instructions and the Group controls framework<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support R&amp;A special projects &amp; timely and effective responses to special data\u002Fproject requests<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong team-working across the process area is essential<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Cooperation with multiple stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Master’s Degree in the following areas: Finance\u002FAccounting\u002FEconomics<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Min 3 years of experience in a relevant accounting environment<\u002Fli>\n       <li><b> General Ledger experience is a must<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n       <li> Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Very good knowledge of Excel<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong communication skills<\u002Fli>\n       <li> ACCA or CIMA certification would be a strong asset<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The role is based in Poland. We do support immigration process (obtaining stay and work permit).<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>As an<b> Analyst Credit Assessment<\u002Fb>, you will be Responsible for the efficient and effective operational management of credit risk according to policy and direction from credit committees. You will be also responsible for providing authorized approval for the release of credit blocked orders and taking credit decisions. Moreover, Actively support the Regional Credit Manager and participate in the virtual regional credit teams.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your main accountabilities would be:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Managing Credit Activities - Responsible for the efficient and effective management of credit risk according to Downstream Credit Manual (DCM) and direction from the credit committee.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><br> Responsible for providing authorized approval for release of credit blocked orders and taking credit decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing an assessment of a customer credit risk and recommending terms of credit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Performing detailed financial analysis based on customer financial statements for the development of a risk profile of a customer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analyzing the overall credit exposure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing authorized approval for continuing deliveries to customers in case of overdue or credit limit exceeding.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Negotiating and managing securities necessary to support higher risk exposures based on a risk-reward approach.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close collaboration with respective Credit Manager and Performing additional tasks from Team Manager.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Minimum 1 year of professional experience in finance or accounting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Degree\u002Fqualifications in Accounting\u002FBanking preferred; a professional degree required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exhibits very good English communication skills (written and oral) B2\u002FC1 level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work under high pressure and in a rapidly changing environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Positively engages with others to improve business processes and performance where necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Risk Management – Knowledge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advanced Financial Knowledge.<br> <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
