<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The Role<\u002Fb><br> <br> Would you like to get to know ins and outs of the Integrated Gas business? Business Analyst role has it all: supports Pearl, the world's largest gas-to-liquids (GTL) plant and one of the world’s largest, most complex and challenging energy projects ever commissioned, own assets and government as important stakeholder. Do you have passion for budgeting, forecasting and management information? Do you thrive dealing with network of stakeholders, mountains of data, trends analysis and at the end seeing how you work influences the business decision making? Do you enjoy continuous improvement and driving the digital journey? You can experience all of that in GTL Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of the role is to deliver end-to-end scope for operated asset Pearl, as well as the relevant functions. Focus area for the role would be to ensure the delivery of business insights as well as transforming the ways of working to the post-Reshape world. The role is to be handled through close cooperation with the wider Qatar finance community. The scope of the role can evolve over time, to align with the business priorities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Specifics of the role include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Prepare all inputs to the financial performance assessment process for the respective budget holders<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Responsible for correct, reliable and meaningful analysis of financial data to enable value adding MI<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Arrange regular meetings with the relevant budget holders, based on standard meeting agenda (actuals vs plan, forecast\u002Flatest estimates updates, treats &amp; opportunities etc.)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Challenge and agree proposal of forecast\u002Flatest estimates updates with the budget holders<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prepare annual Operating Plan in collaboration with budget holders and other members of Finance team<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Responsible for cost allocation and master data management (establish business need, create and maintain allocation set up with support from Controllers)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Support the Reporting team with detailed variance analysis for Group reporting\u002FMI reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide input for relevant audits<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure compliance with the Shell Group Control Framework and relevant standards\u002Fguidelines. Identify and Manage Financial Risk<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Actively participate in the back-up structure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Requirements:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>At least 6 years professional experience in Finance or Accounting<\u002Fli>\n    <li>University degree in Accounting, Finance or equivalent courses with experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li>ACCA\u002FCIMA\u002FIFRS or similar post-graduate qualification would be beneficial<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience in financial statements preparation<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Excellent written and spoken business level in English<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Very good knowledge of all accounting processes or previous experience in other departments within Finance Departments<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong communication and business partnering skills to be capable of developing effective relationships with stakeholders and business partners<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Expected to identify opportunities for optimization, streamlining processes and eliminating non-value activities (Continuous Improvement mindset)<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to work virtually in an effective manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to perform work independently with minimal supervision<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to work in a dynamically changing and demanding environment, ability to quickly learn and adopt to new requirements and tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As an Ethics and Compliance Analyst you will provide advice to a broad and diverse range of business stakeholders to ensure Ethics and Compliance related risks are understood and addressed in particular in the area of Third Party integrity due diligence, including Anti-Bribery and Corruption, Anti-Money Laundering and Trade Compliance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Ethics and Compliance Analyst supporting portfolio companies you will work closely with colleagues from the global team of Ethics and Compliance Managers (ECMs) in providing and standardising support for “portfolio companies” across the various Shell businesses in order to ensure that portfolio companies are compliant with E&amp;C framework and both the transition and implementation are standardised and made easy and intuitive for end users and key stakeholders. Portfolio companies are companies that are Shell controlled whilst not being fully on Shell GID\u002FIT systems which require more bespoke activity in implementing our E&amp;C control framework.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position is a part of Shell's Ethics and Compliance Office (SECO), whose role is to sustain both a culture and a structure within which all decisions and actions are consistent with Shell's core values, Shell General Business Principles and Code of Conduct. You will be one of an existing team of Analysts based in Krakow, reporting to the Ethics and Compliance Manager Poland &amp; Technology.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This is a role that requires strong E&amp;C leadership with stakeholders, including direct engagement and communication across the business and functions. The Ethics and Compliance Analyst must be able to collaborate with and influence stakeholders in other businesses and functions to deliver sustainable and timely results with regular engagement with stakeholders up to VP level. A person in this position must be able to handle small projects as they arise and identify improvement opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Working with ECMs in supporting implementation work for portfolio companies this would include Third Party integrity due diligence requirements (but work may change and evolve);<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working with the ECMs and portfolio companies to ensure E&amp;C requirements are understood by the staff in portfolio companies and the status is visible to the relevant business;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identification of opportunities to simplify and improve efficiencies in the E&amp;C processes and controls for portfolio companies;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver other assigned SECO improvement programmes and projects as determined by the SECO Leadership Team.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> Knowledge and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> University Degree<\u002Fli>\n   <li> 5 years of relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of the Ethics &amp; Compliance standards including Anti-Bribery and Corruption, Anti-Money Laundering and Trade Compliance as well as Third Party integrity due diligence standards.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent written and oral English language skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong influencing and communication skills across diverse business cultures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to operate under pressure and to stand up in the face of conflict or resistance as well as persistence when changes involve many different stakeholders across the Group;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in working across organisational levels, with cross-functional and cross-business teams;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to implement change and project management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good planning and organising skills, able to manage multiple priorities and tasks and have an eye for detail;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrable continuous improvement mindset and skills are a plus for this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>General Position Definition<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> End to end contractor management within global Contingent Workforce Operations (CWO) embraces:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Handling activities for contractors on behalf of hiring managers (sourcing, selecting, hiring, extensions, on boarding\u002Foff boarding). Improving commercial acumen through rates assessment against Shell standard rate cards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Creating data transparency and the ability to quickly identify savings opportunities through Management Information reports.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving consistency in selecting and managing contractors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving data integrity and transparency for business decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Purpose<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Contingent Workforce (CW) Analyst is responsible to provide high quality support to Shell hiring managers through dedicated E2E professional consultancy and administrative activities relating to contingent workforce management. The CW Analyst handles day to day operations, manages queries, advices on policy, Systems workflows, performs commercial rate negotiation to enable access to top talent contingent workforce in the market place.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> First point of contact on Contingent Workforce Inquires from the business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Single point of contact for all non-technical System related queries from business users.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Subject Matter Expert for System Contract Labour and Consultancy processes and policies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identifies and executes Value opportunity in close cooperation with the business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages long term Business relationship\u002Fpartnership ensuring top notch customer service<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages Salesforce Case management system -log, track, manage and resolution of Inquires.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resolves queries\u002Fissues and engage\u002Fescalate to appropriate teams (if required) for issue resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resolves System invoice issues and work with relevant teams for issue resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Delivers Ad Hoc System Training, System Troubleshooting and Help Guides.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate commercial acumen and provide appropriate commercial challenge to business via demand management, specification management and price management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works Ensures correct contractor setup the first time – End to end System Contract creation for Assignment and Project Agreement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Performs appropriate Job Matching to ensure demand is mapped to the correct suppliers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Arranges and manage onboarding virtually; works closely with business to ensure resources are onboarded\u002Foff-boarded successfully<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Reviews and manage change requests from businesses to ensure contracts are updated.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enforces compliance and governance with Human Resources, Categories, Legal and Fiscal policies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identifies cost savings opportunities and work collaboratively with Contracting &amp; Procurement team to deliver the value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provides Hiring Manager with the request status updates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintains data accuracy in System.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> ensure System payment request is complete.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demontratea CI mindset by JUST DO IT initiative<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complies, Executes Standard Operating <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The role of <b>Customer Success Specialist<\u002Fb> – <b>Mobility B2B Deal Management EU<\u002Fb> is to support Territory Managers in Mobility business in on-boarding Retailers and Dealers to Shell and delivering all relevant changes to the Retailer’s\u002F Dealer’s agreement throughout the contract life-cycle. The CSS Deal Management owns pricing and the contract set up, amendment and management process. This role makes sure Retailers and Dealers find it easy to do business with Shell by providing a best-in-market Customer experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Contract Management:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Work with Territory Managers to provide pre-offer, offer and contract management support for standard and non-standard contract set up and maintenance, in compliance with the Play Book<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Execute contract legal and fiscal requirements, working with local legal focals<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Follow-up directly with Retailers on missing contract documentation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Ensure contracts are signed and stored in line with local country requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Review contract performance as part of SCM process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Own contract documentation archiving and termination of Retailers contracts<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Pricing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Set up and maintain end to end pricing data, including confirming pricing, managing price increases and changes, implementing rebates and charge backs, investment deals, invoice accuracy, and resolving pricing related errors and disputes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Trouble Shooting:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Provide “One Team” support for Sales in owning and resolving all Deal Making issue resolution. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are currently looking for an experienced HR Operations Team Lead to join our Krakow Office. If you have strong leadership skills, a passion for continuous improvement and a drive to create the best possible employee experience, this could be a dream job!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The HR Operations Team Lead reports to the Country HR Operations Manager for Poland and is a member of the Polish HR Country Operations Leadership Team. The role leads a team responsible to deliver HR Operations in Poland consisting of over 4500 employees. The role provides leadership to a team of HR Advisors and supports the fostering strong employee engagement.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> PURPOSE<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Manage the delivery of end-to-end HR Operations support to employees and line managers for a given country.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Continuously drive up the quality of HR processes and support provided, through operational excellence and process simplification, aimed at improving overall employee experience.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Lead a team of HR Advisors; growing capability of the team.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Ensure efficient HR processes delivery that meets all clients’ requirements. This entails especially responsiveness and quality of the support that are delivered by the team<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensuring that processes and procedures for the team are in line with policies &amp; guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensuring KPIs and performance metrics are regularly monitored and proactive intervention is established, where required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide staff development, supervision, motivation and leadership within the team. This entails positive recognition opportunities, performance reviews, promoting career development within and outside of the team and giving space for personal and professional growth.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Providing input to streamline processes and procedures within HR Country Operations using best practice, to provide better efficiencies and reduce costs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Handling escalated cases, follow up on resolution, inform customer, document and capture learning gained.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Active participation in various operating\u002Fnetworking HR Operations forums within and outside the designated cluster as well as outside HR Operations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Participate in or lead regional projects aimed at ensuring operational excellence.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Drive Operational Excellence within own team and support Continuous Improvement of offering and processes within own scope.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensure the quality of data being handled, and that the team acts in accordance to Information Compliance and Data Privacy rules.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR<\u002Fb><br> You bring a Learner Mindset, a curiosity to learn and grow yourself, learn from mistakes and a commitment to create an environment where people can speak up openly in a safe environment.<br> You have previous experience in a HR Operations role and prior coaching or leadership experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n    Skills\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Strong IT Skills, especially with MS Office and SAP experience an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Familiarity with HR Systems &amp; Processes.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience in introducing and maintaining service excellence.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to work under pressure and tight constraints.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>(Performance) coaching skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Behaviors\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Accuracy and attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Employee Centric and Service Excellence mindset<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ownership; end to end accountability for resolution<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Performance focus<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Structured and organized<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Knowledge\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Good understanding of HR Model and where to find specialist knowledge<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Knowledge of local and global policies and the associated processes<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are currently looking for an experienced Reward &amp; Job Evaluation professional to join our global Reward and Job Evaluation Team. The main purpose of the team is to create and maintain a high-performing organisation culture by delivering programmes that reward and recognise key employee capabilities, skills, behaviours, experience and performance, ensuring reward systems are market-relevant, equitable and cost-effective; and ensuring job level consistency and internal equity across jobs in Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be part of a natural team, working together to deliver healthy organisational structures and reward systems that are market-relevant, equitable and cost-effective. As consultants to the businesses, functions and countries we collaborate closely with multiple clients across several business units, sites or geographies. We leverage best practices from inside and outside of Shell, contributing to the continuing development of a world-class organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A role in our Reward and Job Evaluation team provides a unique opportunity to learn about Shell in a holistic manner rarely afforded in other roles. You will develop your benchmarking\u002Fcalibration, project management, business acumen, global working, stakeholder engagement and organisational design skills as well as learning the technical competencies of Hay Job Evaluation Methodology and pay benchmarking.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> You will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver job evaluation in small and large sized reorganisations and organisation reviews or analyse the structure health of the organisation unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promote effective and efficient organizations which are satisfying and motivating for employees through the application of sound job evaluation and organizational design principles using the Hay methodology as a foundation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner with the business and HR on implications of structural choices on job grades when designing organisations and provide alternative solutions when needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Help monitor and reinforce (and intervene, if required) good corporate governance in job group management across Shell to provide assurance on the standards of application, and challenge current processes, tools and methodology with a continuous improvement mindset to further our Job Evaluation Journey.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prepare periodic analysis based on organisation data<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Co-develop relevant and fit for purpose tools and frameworks to facilitate the application of sound job evaluation principles within Shell.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Line Managers and HR in their management of JGs by providing and presenting appropriate educational materials e.g. learning programmes and Calibration Tool\u002Ftraining.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support, contribute and lead improvement projects related to JE processes and tools and suggest ideas for simplification, standardisation, automation and elimination, especially of low-value activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver the annual benchmarking and merit budget setting cycle (including supporting mandate setting for CLAs). For more complex countries, under the guidance of their Team Lead.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works within the reward governance guidelines and risk &amp; control framework, monitoring good corporate governance across Shell to provide assurance on the standards of application with a continuous improvement mindset. e.g. Conducts Post Event Control analysis<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures that reward communication materials contain clear, transparent and consistent messages about reward.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flags and supports the management of conflicting perspectives related to reward and JE challenges, aiding parties to reach solutions with the use of data, understanding global standards, local budget, market pressures and ER\u002FIR aspects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree level education or equivalent<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven analytical experience, some of it working with large numerical data sets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be confident working with Excel spreadsheets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Desirable: Experience with job evaluation and\u002For pay benchmarking and\u002For HR data services<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication in English.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self starting, working with diverse groups and levels of stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Corporate Relations), established to develop and execute Shell’s internal communications strategy on a global basis. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role is an individual contributor and will work on a variety of channel management and content related assignments.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Builds collaborative partnerships with IC&amp;E colleagues who work closely with various businesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provides proactive recommendations on best use of content and channels to further connect employees to our strategy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advises advice based on the insights.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develops subject matter knowledge of major business, functional areas or programmes assigned to serve, especially the key business priorities\u002Fchallenges\u002Fopportunities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contributes to development of communications strategies and their implementation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate is expected to demonstrate most of the following attributes:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> Demonstrated ability to write, edit and <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>As an <b>Analyst Credit Debt Collection<\u002Fb>, you will be responsible for performing debt collection activities for Shell operating. This will require creating very good working relationships with the local Credit Team, Sales, and other business partners. Having the ability to meet with the customers to discuss a range of issues but still maintain a solid relationship wherever possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your main accountabilities would be:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for performing debt collection activities for Shell operating units.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for ensuring that customer debts are collected in line with contracted payment terms and in accordance with Downstream Credit Manual.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Adhere to the escalation process in carrying out the debt collection activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for managing release of credit blocked orders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain and foster good working relationships with Sales, the business, and with relevant FO business partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform dispute initiation and monitoring of resolution in accordance with the defined SLA.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform cash allocation and investigate payment discrepancy reasons if the customer fails to provide it in their remittance data.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Recommend and implement solutions for regular offenders, bad payers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Have good communication skills and maximize this to deliver above-average performance in debt collections.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effectively collaborate with team members and other internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide support to the Debt Collection Supervisor<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for candidates who have a bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in the Finance area, we'd hope to see as many following as possible on You CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree in Accounting or any related Finance\u002FBusiness course preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good knowledge of<b>English<\u002Fb>oral &amp; written (min. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>As an <b>Analyst Credit Debt Collection<\u002Fb>, you will be responsible for performing debt collection activities for Shell operating. This will require creating very good working relationships with the local Credit Team, Sales, and other business partners. Having the ability to meet with the customers to discuss a range of issues but still maintain a solid relationship wherever possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your main accountabilities would be:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for performing debt collection activities for Shell operating units.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for ensuring that customer debts are collected in line with contracted payment terms and in accordance with Downstream Credit Manual.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Adhere to the escalation process in carrying out the debt collection activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for managing release of credit blocked orders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain and foster good working relationships with Sales, the business, and with relevant FO business partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform dispute initiation and monitoring of resolution in accordance with the defined SLA.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform cash allocation and investigate payment discrepancy reasons if the customer fails to provide it in their remittance data.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Recommend and implement solutions for regular offenders, bad payers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Have good communication skills and maximize this to deliver above-average performance in debt collections.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effectively collaborate with team members and other internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide support to the Debt Collection Supervisor<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for candidates who have a bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in the Finance area, we'd hope to see as many following as possible on You CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree in Accounting or any related Finance\u002FBusiness course preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good knowledge of<b>English<\u002Fb>oral &amp; written (min. B2\u002FC1).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Very good knowledge of Czech or Slovak (min. C1).<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 1 year of relevant work experience would be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactive and demonstrating full ownership of assigned tasks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in performing call-outs and other collection efforts to third-party customers would be an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. The goal is to provide Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Principle Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The broad accountability of this role is to take ownership, drive accountability, and demonstrate and communicate improvements for our customer journey. portfolio. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The successful candidate will display the following behaviors, as they will enable the candidate to be successful in this challenging role: proactive <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>The purpose of <b>Commercial Lead <\u002Fb>is to develop sourcing strategies and tactics based on a deep understanding of the current situation of the business, the business strategy and drivers, the local supplier market and global strategies. The commercial lead enables stakeholders in the Supply Chain to understand the intent of contracts, optimize the use of contracts, manage Contract(or)s for performance and remove waste. A Commercial Lead is expected to manage complex portfolio of Tactical and Operational contracts (up to 40% Tactical spend) and to handle new demands assigned to Class of Business and category\u002Fcategories according to Category Management Contracting &amp; Procurement (CMCP) guidelines.<\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> YOU WILL<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <ul>\n      <li><p> Design and improve assigned supply chains with business partners, starting with in-house\u002Foutsource choices and (re)designs, the contracting strategy and commercial tactics and post award contract management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Work closely with Category Managers and key stakeholders within various Shell Businesses and Functions to execute Category Management commercial work plans, assuring supply of contracts at market competitive terms and conditions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Develop and implement pragmatic procurement strategies and tactics based on regularly updated cost models, business requirement and supplier industry analyses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Drive total cost reductions and value beyond ‘the usual’ (cash preservation\u002Fcost savings\u002Fprocess efficiency). Identify opportunities in the contract portfolio to create more value and\u002For to eliminate waste.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Determine the right remuneration model (e.g. output-based contract) to encourage the right behaviors and expectations from suppliers to optimize alignment of supply chain and asset delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Deliver Operational Excellence in the development of contracting strategy to post award contract management. This includes management of cycle times in accordance with business needs and ensuring SC operations organization and SC Operations managed processes are easy to work with.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Drive Continuous Improvement principles to create a performance culture. Drive and support the CP Compliance with processes and regulations. Implement standard processes, methodologies, tools, and enablers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> REQUIREMENTS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <ul>\n      <li><p> 4-7 years of professional experience -<b> Contract Strategy building<\u002Fb> and Post-Award process,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Practical knowledge of<b> Category Management <\u002Fb>process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Great <b>Deal Making<\u002Fb> skills – proven by strong Continuous Improvement delivery,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p><b> Commercial savvy,<\u002Fb> business acumen, ability to work on numerous fronts across several initiatives,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> High-energy individual with entrepreneurial mindset, good people skills and the ability to deliver,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Strong <b>Business Partnering <\u002Fb>skills,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Strong leadership and self-confidence in order to<b> engage senior stakeholders,<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> University degree or equivalent required,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p><b> Proficiency in English.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> WHO WE ARE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <ul>\n      <li><p> Leader in Energy Transition \u002FDecarbonization processes worldwide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <li><p> Leading Supply Chain function on Polish labor market with a potential to grow with multi opportunities to grow within our global\u002Finter-centers management. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>If you are an<b> audit professional<\u002Fb> and are excited to be part of the journey to build and sustain an ethical culture in Shell, then this role could be the opportunity you are looking for. As a member of the Shell Ethics and Compliance (E&amp;C) Assurance team, you will be delivering a programme of E&amp;C assurance activity covering the full range of activities in the E&amp;C manual. Working in teams you will deliver assurance reviews and provide advice and insights to improve the E&amp;C control framework. As a key member of the newly created E&amp;C assurance team you will also play a role in contributing to the assurance methodology, processes and ways of working for E&amp;C assurance. The role will bring you into contact with a wide range of stakeholders across seniority levels and business areas in the organisation and is a great opportunity to apply and develop your communication and stakeholder management skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver Ethics and compliance assurance reviews as a team member;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver the review testing programme in line with agreed protocols;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute quality interviews and testing;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assess results to provide assurance, identify issues, insights and make high quality recommendations;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver quality working documentation;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute to reporting out on the outcomes of assurance services and activities to stakeholders;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide expertise in specific areas of the E&amp;C manual to other review team members (based on own areas of expertise).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the E&amp;C assurance manager to develop, maintain and improve the assurance methodology, processes and ways of working for E&amp;C assurance;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Where applicable contribute as part of project teams to the delivery of specific E&amp;C assurance activities e.g. the development of the annual assurance plan, reporting of integrated assurance outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As an E&amp;C assurance specialist you will be primarily delivering assurance reviews as a team member. You will also have the opportunity to lead assurance reviews as you gain experience in the role.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To be successful you will need to be resilient, able to manage competing priorities, decisive, highly collaborative and have great team working, listening and influencing skills. Like your colleagues your passion for and advocacy of ethical behaviours will shine through and motivate those around you. You will act with integrity and transparency, even in difficult situations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> You will ideally have both prior experience in auditing \u002F assurance and in Ethics and compliance and related requirements. However, applicants with one of these areas of experience will be considered.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The E&amp;C assurance specialist is a member of the SECO (Shell Ethics and Compliance Office) Assurance team and will report to the SECO Assurance Manager.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The SECO assurance team is responsible for Ethics and Compliance assurance globally, covering all businesses and functions and all areas of the E&amp;C Manual within Shell. The E&amp;C assurance specialist will participate in assurance reviews from planning, through execution to reporting. Reviews will vary in duration from 2 to 4 weeks and in scope from covering a country, a business area, class of business or function.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The E&amp;C assurance specialist will interact with stakeholders at senior levels and will be expected to demonstrate strong communication skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills and Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> Audit or assurance qualification<\u002Fb> e.g. Qualified Chartered Accountant, Certified Internal Auditor or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 3+ years experience working in <b>audit or assurance roles.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Practical experience with assurance, auditing, testing and assessing control frameworks.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Interpersonal and team working skills;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Courage to intervene and challenge status quo;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Qualities of independence, objectivity and analysis;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-motivated, organized and adaptable;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Presentation skills &amp; ability to communicate credibly with senior management;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skill in assurance processes and frameworks;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of risk management; compliance programmes; and control frameworks;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Ethics and Compliance and related requirements;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in the assurance of Ethics and Compliance risks;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Planning and organising skills with robust attention to detail; and<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working in dynamic, ambiguous and pressured environments requiring personal integrity, courage, independence and resilience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The Role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you are a data scientist with a passion to show business impact and value to the business with your data science skills, this could be a right opportunity for you to apply.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a data scientist you’re going to be responsible for:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> End to end delivery of specific analytics projects in Finance domain<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Developing advanced Data science solutions for problem statements in Finance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generating business insights from data analytics at the request from the business, generate and enable value to the business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identifying new value pockets and bring key business stakeholders on board and enable value through project delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Setting up and demonstrating world class standards and best practices in project execution and quality of delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Articulating clearly, the data science work, its approach, and its value to all stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We need a strong individual contributor with excellent delivery skills. Experience of presenting customer centricity solutions and understanding of the business will also be a key skill for this role.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong experience in data science\u002FAnalytics projects, particularly Forecasting (great if some work is documented in a GitHub repo)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> It would be an advantage if the candidate has completed 1 to 2 projects in Finance domain using analytics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of Finance\u002F Financial Accounting is an additional advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of SQL and Python or R is essential<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Familiarity with key concepts of object-oriented programming<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of SAP, Power BI and\u002For Alteryx would be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficiency in any other programming languages (especially C++, Java, SCALA) would be an advantage; knowledge of cloud technology would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Expertise in Statistics \u002F Mathematics [Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, Univariate \u002F Multivariate Analysis, Cluster Analysis, Classification\u002FPCA, Factor Analysis, Linear Modeling, Logit\u002FProbit Model, Affinity &amp; Association, Time Series, DoE, distribution \u002F probability theory]<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Expertise in Advanced Timeseries forecasting techniques, Advanced Machine learning techniques [ Decision Trees, Neural Networks, Deep Learning, Support Vector Machines, Clustering, Bayesian Networks, Reinforcement Learning, Feature Reduction \u002F engineering, Anomaly deduction, Natural Language Processing (incl. Theme deduction, sentiment analysis, Topic Modeling), Natural Language Generation<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. and work in a very dynamic and constantly changing environment, this role gives you that opportunity. This position will play an important role in cost control and providing challenge and support to business decision-making. If you have reporting skills and ability to build strong working relationships with all levels of stakeholders, this could be the opportunity for you.<br> <br> Where do you fit in?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Reporting directly to the Reporting &amp; Analysis (R&amp;A) Lead Renewable Generation you will be the part of the e2e R&amp;A team supporting the business. You will work closely with the colleagues within the team, as well as across the organization to deliver good quality project accounting and reporting. Next to this you’ll actively help the team identify process improvement opportunities and be empowered to deliver and implement them, sharing best practice and your learnings along the way.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> What’s the role?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The primary role of Project Accountant will be to support Renewables and Energy Solutions teams with projects reporting and management including Master Data, verification of costs allocated to projects, time writing reviews, projects closure, billings. More specifically the role will require to deliver:<br> MRD support:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Cost Centre, Project codes, WBSs, etc. creation for Renewables and Energy Solutions projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Time Writing support:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Review &amp; follow up time writing compliance of New Energies (NE) staffs, to deliver no\u002Fminimum missing time writing at the end of month.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Costs accuracy:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Ensure that costs allocated to projects are captured in the right place<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cooperation with other NE functions (i.e. CP, HR, others) to ensure right codes are used for services, people are assigned to the right Cost Center<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cost reclasses\u002F billing instruction as needed\u002F month-end accruals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure right budget assigned to project<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor spend vs Budget and timely react to overspend<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicate cost performance to Project Manager<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accruals - postings and accrual control<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Management information and business decision support:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Interpreting financial information and provide adequate challenge &amp; analytical support to the Business Stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support LE process by templates preparation and R1 submission<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support Planning process<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Strong reporting skills and experience with use of reporting tools (SAP). Excellent excel skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work in a dynamically changing and demanding environment, ability to quickly learn and adopt to new requirements and tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to remain resilient under time pressure and independently prioritise multiple competing priorities whilst maintaining appropriate attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to build strong working relationships with all levels of stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proactively look beyond the scope of requests being made and apply creativity in developing solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Improvement mindset, with experience of identifying and driving improvement projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Openness to embrace change and remain focused even where ambiguity exists<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication &amp; partnering skills as well as interpersonal and relationship building skills. Good communications skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong Team Player. Ability to work with virtual teams, across cultures and time zones<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent written and spoken business level in English<\u002Fli>\n   <li> 3+ years of experience in Financial area<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. accounting. accounted numbers into standard reports.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Principal accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Group Reporting,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Management Information Reporting,<\u002Fli>\n locations,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Initiate and lead process improvements,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Comply with team, Shell Business Operations, process and global policies and procedures,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Regulatory Chemistry Team<\u002Fb> provides regulatory chemistry support for Shell lubricants and their customers for 3500 finished lubricants, 2000 additive packs, 6000 substances across 140 countries. Regulatory Chemistry Team provides support to Regional Product Stewards and Lubricants businesses, interacting with a network of contacts in SDS Authoring, Technology, Product Management, external suppliers, and customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountability:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver detailed HSE information that is ‘fit for purpose’ maximizing efficiencies with no compromise to quality whilst protecting company intellectual property.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for verifying supplier HSE classifications for purchased products used in our blending plants and proposing final product HSE classifications and any actions for plants on managing chemical hazards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing customer regulatory enquiries about Shell lubricants products.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with Stakeholders (Tech Managers, Global Product Managers, and Product Stewards) to advise on HSE issues arising from individual additive and saleable product assessments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for Shell Lubricants' impact assessment process of HSE classification and compliance changes for purchased specific projects within own specialist area including short-term data management and process improvements in HSE assessment area to improve data accuracy, customer experience, and time to market.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely and accurate regulatory data disclosures or assessments according to high-level priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Produce reports using and contracting activities, where you will manage portfolio of contracts and handle new demands within Global Functions scope (including but not limited to HR, Consulting, Professional Services, Real Estate and Facility Management), according to Category Management Contracting &amp; Procurement guidelines. You will be accountable for aggregating\u002Fleveraging third-party spend, developing and executing sourcing strategy to optimise Shell’s buying power and reduce the overall 3rd party expenditure. As a Senior Sourcing Buyer you will ensure that sourcing strategy is in line with Business\u002FFunction priorities through regular engagement with key business stakeholders and suppliers, in order to achieve annual, integrated cost improvement targets. Your responsibility would be to manage tail spend by working closely with Category Management Team and maximize value on operational and tactical contracts.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> You will work closely with Category Management Team and key stakeholders within various Shell Businesses and Functions to execute Category Management commercial work plans and deliver substantial value to Shell Businesses and Functions by:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Creating a deeper business partnership within the scope of the role focused on delivering maximum business value<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Utilizing market knowledge and business drivers to develop and execute fit-for-purpose commercial strategies and work plans for Tactical and Operational spend<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Setting and executing sourcing activities end to end across multiple Businesses\u002FFunctions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Managing a low and medium complexity contract portfolio<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Developing, tendering and negotiating contracts in line with the Business Demand<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Maximizing value from Tactical and Operational contracts by spend consolidation and implementation of Enterprise Framework Agreements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Delivering end-to-end cost savings impacting RDS bottom line Requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Approximately 3-5 years of professional experience including procurement activities, sourcing and contracts negotiations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Fluent English (C1)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Bachelor or Master’s Degree in any Commercial Discipline, including Law, Economics, Finance, Supply Chain\u002FCP, Business\u002FManagement (including HR) and Marketing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ability to make decisions even under circumstances of ambiguity of information without full picture known<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ability to engage stakeholders, manage and influence business decisions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Good organization skills and ability to manage competing priorities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Strong analytical skills and ability to work independently<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Very good commercial sense and understanding of procurement and legal aspects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Familiarity with SAP Ariba, SAP Blueprint or RtP process would be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> WHO WE ARE<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Leader in Energy Transition \u002FDecarbonization processes worldwide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Leading Supply Chain function on Polish labor market with a potential to grow with multi opportunities to grow within our global\u002Finter-centers structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Complex and business oriented projects for Experienced Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain Professionals and close- to-business project professionals, experienced in contracting, procurement and supply chain processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Opportunity to participate in Digital transformation and Data usage for Contract Procurement and Supply Chain E2E process;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Innovators, with whom you would work on Digital transformation;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Business proximity and true impact of Contract Procurement and Supply Chain function is Shell; \u002FPeople, who have true impact on business, by developing acumen, proximity and driving real changes in Procurement and Supply Chain functions at Shell<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> HOW YOU START<\u002Fp>\n country;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Employee Referral Program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> HOW YOU WILL DEVELOP<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> By clear career path and Talent Management program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> By learning and development programs to skill up within 11 Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain competencies;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> By additional funds for trainings and certifications (ACCA, CIMA, CIPS, Lean Six Sigma);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> By Contract Procurement and people experience, this job is perfect for you.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you do not have previous experience in HR, do not worry, we will pass on to you our passion to HR world.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role about:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As Junior HR Advisor you will be responsible for providing end to end HR support to employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Management of end-to-end queries according to established ways of working, using Salesforce tool to log queries and updates<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Keeping employees updated on the status of open queries. Liaising with HR Business Partners, HR in the Country, Employees and Line Managers, as required in order to resolve the query<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execution of complex Local HR Processes, in line with existing policies and procedures, assuring high quality data management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely escalation of complex queries to senior advisors, SMEs and policy teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing input for Knowledge Management within the team (including creation and ownership of documentation\u002F job aids)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sharing best practices within the team, striving for continual improvement in service delivery, participating in improvement initiatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for candidates who have empathy and excellent investigation skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Advanced level in French (C1)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good command in English (B2 level is a minimum)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Continuous improvement &amp; Learner mindset<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent time management skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to ask quality questions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The SEAM organization integrates Safety, Environment &amp; Asset Management activities, with a broad geographical footprint, that will support Shell’s business &amp; assets around the world. Technical Asset Operations (TAO), which sits in SEAM, is a key enabler for the accelerated delivery of Shell’s Asset Management System and will help us to reach our ultimate potential in Chemicals and Products (C+P), Integrated Gas\u002FRenewables, and Energy Solutions (IGRES) and Upstream. TAO provides high-quality and cost-competitive technical resources who are not physically present at the site yet are an integral part of asset teams delivering value through end-to-end AMS work processes. The TAO teams are located across 4 locations: Chennai, Manila, KL &amp; Krakow.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Technical Specialist for Reservoir Engineering is expected to be connected with various subsurface and reservoir engineering colleagues in assets and streamline and document the data management process. Scope of the work covers also helps the Well, Reservoir, and Facility Management (WRFM) community in extracting the required data for any WRFM review process, as well as helps the assets in capturing fluid, pressure, SCAL, reservoir properties, and managing key subsurface uncertainties. A candidate is expected to have good Knowledge of reservoir performance analysis and maturation of hydrocarbon volumes. Experience in analyzing and reporting HC Resource volume data, annual business planning, and reserves reporting to SEC are added advantages.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work closely with Assets \u002F Reservoir Engineer in maintaining and providing necessary access\u002Fdata for various reservoir studies\u002Freviews.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand and provide support on necessary reports &amp; workflows during the annual reporting cycles.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead Reserves reporting, Subsurface Benchmarking, and Portfolio Analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform a quality check and connect with relevant stakeholders for verification\u002Frectification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Visualize, analyze and load PTA (Build Up \u002F Fall off pressure).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Assets with Reserves estimation and classification, production forecasting, well testing, and MBAL Modelling.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in WRFM reviews and record opportunities and uncertainties.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in reservoir engineering network and share key achievements and challenges.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a team player and coach \u002Ftrain other colleagues in reservoir engineering processes\u002Fworkflows as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University Degree in Geoscience, Reservoir Engineering, Petroleum Engineering, or relevant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Required 5+ yrs experience in relevant areas such as field development studies, reservoir studies, Production Forecasting, Annual Reserves Reporting, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good Data skills in identifying data sources, analyzing data quality, and providing reliable data.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong process knowledge in Subsurface &amp; WRFM.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to support Exploration and Development activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong working experience in Reservoir Engineering related applications (OFM, MBAL, Ecrin).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in applying CI methods for process improvements is a good addition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Python, VBA, Power BI and\u002For Spotfire knowledge would be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>We are looking for a Reward Consultant to join the Rewards &amp; Job Evaluation team and be part of Shell’s Performance and Reward community. Our global Reward team combines the expertise areas of Reward and Job Evaluation, and team members work across both.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> You will be part of a natural team, working together to deliver healthy organisational structures and reward systems that are market-relevant, equitable and cost-effective. As consultants to the businesses, functions and countries we collaborate closely with multiple clients across several business units, sites or geographies. We leverage best practices from inside and outside of Shell, contributing to the continuing development of a world-class organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> A role in our Reward and Job Evaluation team provides a unique opportunity to learn about Shell and have impact in a holistic manner rarely afforded in other roles. You will develop your benchmarking\u002Fcalibration, project management, business acumen, global working, stakeholder engagement and organisational design skills.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <b> The purpose of the role is:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <ul>\n      <li>To develop pay programmes for a portfolio of countries that enable Shell to deliver its Performance and Reward philosophy of ensuring competitive pay that is aligned to our aspired competitive position in the local market<\u002Fli>\n      <li>To provide advice to HR Operations and HR in the Business on policy and compensation related matter<\u002Fli>\n      <li>To provide support and advice to Reward Management colleagues as required, especially in same location\u002Fregion.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <b> Key Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Deliver the annual pay benchmarking process for a portfolio of countries. This includes the processes for data submission to external surveys, market analysis and developing pay outcomes which are supported by the country.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Develop pay programmes for these countries that enable Shell to deliver its Performance and Reward philosophy of ensuring competitive pay that is aligned to our aspired competitive position in the local market.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Develop strong collaborative working relationships with stakeholders, in particular Country HR Managers and Reward \u002F Country Policy Advisors.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Coordinate the annual Global Reward Information Datastore (GRID) and Cost of Employment (COE) for countries in the portfolio, as input for budget planning information to Finance.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Contribute to continuous process improvement and increase of efficiency in the Reward Management centre of expertise.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Participate in the development, roll-out and maintenance of specific global Reward policies and processes.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Assist in the coordination and delivery of the annual HR Performance and Reward learning programme.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Provide advice on Reward matters, and on the application of Shell’s global pay policies.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Deliver the contractual and operational relationship with suppliers of salary surveys.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Provide advice and support for businesses and line managers on individual pay pressure cases<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Provide advice and support for Reward Policy Advisors on collective pay pressure cases<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Contribute to specific remuneration projects, and other projects and\u002For focal point roles assigned to the position.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Maintain external focus through network groups and other sources of external information and data. Represent Shell in industry networks.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Ensure consistent application of and alignment to the global compensation related policies and processes for countries in the region.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Support Country reviews (benefits benchmarking, pay mix review, realignment of Target Total Cash \u002F Total remuneration with the market).<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful> Challenges\n     <br> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Manage conflicting perspectives related to pay challenges, bring parties to consensus and a robust conclusion by balancing global standards, local budget and market pressures and ER\u002FIR aspects. The role is part of a global team with work colleagues in various time zones. Must be comfortable to work and connect with colleagues virtually.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Establish a close, trust based relationship, with country HR focal points in the region in order to agree a multi-year trajectory on market alignment and stay on top of local developments<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <b> Requirements:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Experienced HR professional with exposure to delivery of Reward policies and processes in the business.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Sound understanding of Reward philosophy and supporting principles and policies.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>University level degree, or similar level professional qualification.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Strong numerical and analytical skills.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Advanced Excel capability\u002Faptitude. SharePoint experience.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Able to work with numerous and concurrent deadlines to deliver solutions.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Must have strong interpersonal and client relationship skills.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Be a team player.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Able to operate effectively with internal customers and colleagues in a virtual environment, as well as with 3rd party service providers.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Able to hold ground in discussion with senior stakeholders on pay policies and decisions.<\u002Fli>\n      <li>Experience with pay benchmarking and\u002For HR data services will be beneficial<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Tax team (MDT Team). It provides a very good exposure on Direct Tax Compliance and Group Reporting.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Prepare and deliver tax calculation, payments, tax returns<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support audit (internal, external and Tax Authorities);<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop templates and collate information to respond inquiries from tax authorities and internal stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepare and Support Annual Tax Return Preparation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure timely submission of internal reports for direct tax reconciliation to<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support on the preparation for various tax accounts reconciliation;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide Quarterly submission of direct tax key performance indicators;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resolve basic direct tax issues, liaise with counter parties and other departments on variances reconciliations, plausibility checks, dry-run analysis;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Providing support to Business Groups in their control of business related tax risks with accuracy and timely.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> University degree (Law, Economy, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting preferable).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in accounting\u002Ffinance in multinational environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluent English<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Basic knowledge of Direct Tax calculation and Tax Return preparation would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Microsoft Office skills, specially Excel tool<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Very good communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Comfortable working under time pressure situations<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This job forms part of the Order to Delivery Journey and provides high-quality frontline Customer facing service to support the Customer success End to End<br> integrated team (General Public and Loyalty, Digital, mobility). The Customer Operations Specialist needs to project a professional company image by providing<br> the best customer experience through phone interaction, emails, ticketing, live chat, and social media engagements with Customers. The Customer Operations<br> Specialist delivers effective communications, value-adding interactions, and efficient issue resolution.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><br> <b>Customer Success Specialist (CSS)<\u002Fb> is empowered to manage customer experience, relationships, and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers.<br> This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash journeys forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfilment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer<br> support, from contract and account set-up to order and payment. CSS provides Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable, and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role includes:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Handle a range of front-line Customer inquiries within the agreed processes and ways of working, including:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Feedback and Issues: Take ownership for the resolution of Integrated Retail B2C complaints, feedback, and compliments, liaising with other service<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> partners as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Offers and Promotions: Deal with Customer calls and e-mails regarding promotions, third-party offers, gift delivery, balance inquiry, Premium membership.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform compliance checks on fraud and manual data quality control.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the redeeming and transferring of Customer Loyalty points.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage the lost\u002Fstolen\u002Fforgotten cards process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Shell’s Customers on digital channels and proactively encourage self-support solutions, ensuring customers are aware of the information and tools<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> on the website and mobile application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><br> In this position, you should have a lot of motivation to work, also be a team player who has strong communication skills. We have hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> English Language Proficiency – C1<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Italian Language Proficiency – C1<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree preferred (Business related major) or equivalent experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Previous experience in Customer service will be an asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to demonstrate resilience and patience, especially when interacting with challenging customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to develop an extensive network of contacts, subject matter experts, and decision-makers across the business to help resolve the more complex<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Customer problems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Possess a strong Customer service ethic and ability to understand, meet and champion the Customer’s needs, while staying within the policies and<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> procedures of Shell.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
