<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This is a senior position where you will manage portfolio of contracts, lead improvement initiatives and handle new demands assigned to Category Management Contracting &amp; Procurement guidelines. You will be accountable for aggregating\u002Fleveraging third-party spend\u002Fdemand and to develop\u002Fexecute the sourcing strategy to optimize Shell’s buying power and reduce the overall spend. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a <b>Sourcing Lead in Shell Lubricants EMEA <\u002Fb>team, you will ensure the Sourcing Strategy is aligned with Business\u002FFunction priorities through regular engagement with key business stakeholders and 3rd party suppliers to establish annual, integrated cost saving targets. Your responsibility will be to manage effectively portfolio of contracts, lead OPEX\u002FCAPEX projects, manage tail end spend by working in close coordination with Procurement Managers\u002FCategory Managers, maximize value from Operational Contracts and implement Category contracts and ensure continuity of supply through managing ad-hoc business requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Internal Shell role’s name is CP (Contracting&amp;Procurement) Commercial Lead. <b>Apart of proven purchasing expertise, the role requires strong leadership skillset<\u002Fb>, however, there are no subordinatesreporting to that person. The expected skills are comparable to the expectations for the role of junior category manager.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an individual contributor role, where the core operations will be delivered to our Production Plant in Spain, but part of the job will be as well connected with the cross-countries projects management for European production plants.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Principal Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work with various customers and stakeholders to execute Category Management commercial work plans, assuring supply of contracts at market competitive terms and conditions, as well as delivering value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contracting and procuring services as well as developing and managing local agreements under the direction of the Local Procurement Lead and Global Category Manager as appropriate<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Applying leading edge supply chain management techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Applying supply\u002Fvalue chain analyses and Total Cost of Ownership modelling<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Scoping local projects, and analyzing CP business requirements and external market dynamics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Developing and executing commercial contract strategies as well as commercially managing operational and tactical agreements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute Contract Management process for assigned operational and tactical contracts<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure all commercial activity is fully aligned with the Global Category Management commercial strategies and Tail spend principles<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage one-off Purchase Orders - Reduce\u002Frationalize number of Contracts\u002FSuppliers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver end-to-end cost savings<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage portfolio of Operational Contracts (aggregated contract risk low and med) and some tactical contracts in line with contract segmentation guidelines and principles. Majority of contracts in the portfolio are standalones.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Purchase of Direct and Indirect purchases related to Shell asset’s maintenance (e.g. Production plants) and production process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> <b>Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good commercial sense and understanding of procurement (5-7 years of professional Procurement experience - including 2-4 years of Tactical contracts management, Contract Strategy building and Post-Award process)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Proficiency in Spanish and English is a must (C1) <\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Practical knowledge of Category Management process – documented by participation in regional\u002Fglobal projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Great Deal Making skills – proven by strong CI delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercial savvy, business acumen, ability to work on numerous fronts across several initiatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High-energy individual with entrepreneurial mindset, good people skills and the ability to deliver<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong Business Partnering skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engineering and project management experience\u002Fbackground will be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional CP qualification preferred, CIPS Certification (or similar) is an added advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Organized and able to manage competing priorities team player<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analytical, Continuous Improvement and digital mindset<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHO WE ARE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Leader in Energy Transition \u002FDecarbonization processes worldwide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leading Supply Chain function on Polish labor market with a potential to grow with multi opportunities to grow within our global\u002Finter-centers structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complex and business-oriented projects for Experienced Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain Professionals and close- to-business project professionals, experienced in contracting, procurement and supply chain processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Opportunity to participate in Digital transformation and Data usage for Contract Procurement and Supply Chain E2E process;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Innovators, with whom you would work on Digital transformation;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business proximity and true impact of Contract Procurement and Supply Chain function is Shell; \u002FPeople, who have true impact on business, by developing acumen, proximity and driving real changes in Procurement and <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The role sits as part of the People Insights team within HR Operations &amp; Employee Experience. The incumbent will be reporting to the Team Lead, HR Process Insights. The People Insights team consists of Reporting experts that deliver MI\u002FReporting to the Businesses\u002FFunctions and Centre of Excellence.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The HR Data Analyst is responsible for preparing HR related reports (that include but not limited to Learning, Recruitment, Goals &amp; Performance Summary &amp; IM reports) and publishing them on specified dates\u002Ffrequency. The key goal is to see ‘reporting’ beyond numbers and add value to the business\u002Forganization. This position will own and deliver the reports on agreed timelines and will be the first point of contact for Business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Run and Maintain MI, including complex analysis and manipulation of data from multiple sources &amp; data privacy assurance<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Running periodic MI processes, e.g. Data Quality, preparation of MI Packs, Competency Reporting<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Continuously develop the ‘reporting’ activities and provide basic analysis to complex analytics<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Work closely with stakeholders on any adhoc requests, be the first point of escalation to resolve any report related issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Become a subject-matter-expert in reporting and the Learning\u002FRecruitment data model<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Complete understanding of the fields in Workday &amp; associated interfaces<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Understanding the data fields, definitions, input, output (across multiple systems) and data quality requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proficient in building, maintaining &amp; redesigning reports in Workday, Power BI, understanding of access management<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Support the self-services around data, reporting and MI<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Write clear and understandable guidelines, best practices, instructions and training materials<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Own &amp; Maintain the Workday Reports, Power BI dashboards and its content &amp; control the authorization requests<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Work towards simplification, standardization and automation<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Analyze the impact of proposed changes to processes and\u002For systems on data, reporting and MI &amp; proactively highlight the same to the stakeholder<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide full support to future Workday enhancements<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Special Challenges<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be able to work closely and effectively with a variety of stakeholders at different levels in the Organization<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Analysis of customer requirements and being able to effectively provide a Management Information consultancy service beyond running reports<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Fluent in English, both verbal and in writing<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proficient in Microsoft Excel, formulas and its features<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and visualization<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proficient in Power BI report building<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Prior experience working with tools such as Salesforce, Workday would be an added advantage<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to understand requirements of stakeholders and deliver the necessary insights and requirements in a time pressure environment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to comprehend well in advance the impact of system changes\u002Fupgrade, to the reports handled &amp; proactively engage the stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to be assertive in seeking information from various data sources to develop meaningful reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to manage and prioritize multiple parallel deliverables, performing quality checks on own output to assure accuracy &amp; complete adherence to data privacy policy whilst ensuring high level of accuracy<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Logical and Analytical thinking<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Resilient and able to work under pressure to tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Solid influencing and engagement skills in a complex environment<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Strong communication skills and stakeholder management skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Have a learner mindset and respectful of various cultures and styles of working<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell <b>Chemicals &amp; Products<\u002Fb> will go through a major transformation in the coming decades to achieve net zero CO2 emissions. The plans have been developed to drastically reduce emissions in the short term and at the same time be able to make a profit. We will do that as Shell Energy and Chemicals Parks. The Shell Contracting &amp; Procurement in Krakow is therefore looking for enthusiastic and capable candidates eager and ready to support from the procurement side the exciting journey of the Energy Transition for Energy and Chemicals Parks in North-West Europe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This posting is for a <b>Supply Chain Commercial Lead <\u002Fb>supporting the Chemicals and Products business at the Shell Energy &amp; Chemicals Parks in North-West Europe. Within this business significant Capex investments are to be made within the upcoming years to achieve the Transformation agenda in term of CO2 Neutrality by latest 2050 and a 30% reduction on its CO2 emissions by 2030.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Supply Chain (SC) Commercial Lead is viewed as a key commercial position to lead\u002F manage contracting and procurement activities to ensure that sites are optimizing<b> non-hydrocarbon 3rd party spend<\u002Fb>, where appropriate across the North-West Europe (“NWE”) region (includes Sites in the Netherland and\u002For Germany).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role offers the opportunity to drive change, both in the internal ways of working (high focus on increased end to end view and integration) as well as in the management of tactical\u002Foperational suppliers and contracts, ensuring we have or choose the right “partners for the future” who will support in structural value-generation while embracing the Chemicals &amp; Products Transformation agenda (as outlined above).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> By joining this CP Ops team, you will be part of a dynamic, challenging and leading-edge Supply Chain Commercial Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions and challenges:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Projects: small to medium complexity projects (value per project circa 1 – 20 mln EUR)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As a Supply Chain Commercial Lead, you are required to work collaboratively with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders, including with global category teams and implement, where appropriate, Local and Enterprise Framework Agreements (EFA’s).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive good commercial outcomes by working effectively with the Category Lead, contract holder, other communities for projects related tenders and local and multi-site contracts including EFA's.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working in a global, virtual team being flexible with hours and travel (moderate)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work across organizational boundaries and interface with varying levels of management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Adapting to changing circumstances\u002Fpriorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to deliver high quality results with minimal supervision<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop commercially competitive sourcing strategies and tactics that meet the business demand<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and own end-to-end sourcing and contracting process, which includes conduct tenders, evaluate bids and drive negotiations, develop and negotiate contracts (where relevant) and manage subsequent supplier performance, following internal governance principles.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong focus on project delivery on time, on budget and on quality through driving right conversations and proper alignment with project stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage supplier relationship including the resolution of operational and supplier performance issues (“claims”) relating to the contracts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead the change management effort to implement new strategies and tools implemented at the site by engaging with relevant stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Improve both contract and supplier management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive continuous improvement with suppliers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Part of the virtual team. No direct reports. Based in Krakow<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor degree in industrial engineering, business administration, supply chain or other relevant fields<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 5+ experience in Contracting &amp; Procurement or Supply Chain or Manufacturing \u002F Construction Projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience gained in an operating plant environment or having supported customers in a plant environment where most contracts are of high HSSE (Health, Safety, Security, Environment) risk category, experience in Manufacturing \u002F Engineering \u002F Construction is considered a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in negotiation of contracts with various levels of complexity<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercial mindset, delivery oriented<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of contract management experience and continuous improvement, as well as successful contracts negotiations delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong end to end process management thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be an effective and clear communicator able to manage conflicts in a sensible, fair and efficient manner<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong and proven interpersonal, influencing &amp; stakeholder management skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to work with multiple internal and external stakeholders across the business and influence without authority<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate ability to analyse, monitor, influence and manage progress and follow up as required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a creative thinker, demonstrating intellectual curiosity and challenging the status quo<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in business English, ability to speak the local site language - Dutch or German will be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> WHO WE ARE<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Leader in Energy Transition \u002FDecarbonization processes worldwide<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leading Supply Chain function on Polish labor market with a potential to grow with multi opportunities to grow within our global\u002Finter-centers structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complex and business oriented projects for Experienced Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain Professionals and close- to-business project professionals, experienced in contracting, procurement and supply chain processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Opportunity to participate in Digital transformation and Data usage for Contract Procurement and Supply Chain E2E process;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Innovators, with whom you would work on Digital transformation;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business proximity and true impact of Contract Procurement and Supply Chain function is Shell; \u002FPeople, who have true impact on business, by developing acumen, proximity and driving real changes in Procurement and Supply Chain functions at Shell<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> HOW YOU START<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> “You are in a Safe Hands” our unique four phases onboarding program<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attractive relocation package available once relocating from another country;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Employee Referral Program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> HOW YOU WILL DEVELOP<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> By clear career path and Talent Management program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By learning and development programs to skill up within 11 Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain competencies;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By additional funds for trainings and certifications (CIPS, Lean Six Sigma);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> By Contract Procurement and Supply Chain Mentoring program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> HOW WE WORK<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Flexible working time (hybrid work);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Complex medical care and individual life insurance;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Comfortable working environment: newly-built modern office with its own canteen, relax rooms, bike &amp; car parking space;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Improved accessibility of office and sanitary facilities;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attractive salary package;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Shell Card for fuel discount;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> MultiSport Card (12 sports sections);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Vouchers for cultural and free time activities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> WHAT WE FEEL \u002FWHAT IS OUR CULTURE<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Honesty, Integrity and Respect for each other as Contract Procurement and Supply Chain core values;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Energetic and Friendly atmosphere at work;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Employee Engagement groups – where can influence on Contract and Procurement and Supply Chain work environment;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assistive technologies and reasonable adjustments for people with disabilities;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> “Bring Mother back into the workforce” program;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This role is a unique opportunity to contribute to the next phase of the Finance Continuous Improvement (CI) journey aimed at growing CI capability, delivery and mindset in Finance. The role provides an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to make a real difference by improving performance and embedding a CI culture.<br> <br> <b>Where does it fit in?<\u002Fb><br> As a Centre of Expertise for the function, Finance Operations (FO) also supports the wider CI deployment in Finance, either through dedicated CI specialists or via support of CI teams within the Business. The CI organization is one pillar of the Operational Excellence organisation. CI Finance comprises ~50 CI Specialists who are assigned to specific CI deployments (Process or Functional Treasury\u002FTax) with a small central team responsible for management of the CI Standard Ways of Working, CI Competence and CI Learning Curriculum and a team of ~30 developers and specialists supporting FO in deploying Smart Automation tool sets to drive their digital ambition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As Senior CI Portfolio Lead, the role will support Finance Function in achieving the delivery of their Continuous Improvement programme to improve key metrics performance, generate bottom line value savings and add business value. In line with the CI vision of:<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Teaching to fish:<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Equipping teams with the right behaviours and skillset to drive CI everyday<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Train &amp; Coach on improvement project delivery, including Lean Sigma, Change Management, and Agile<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Train &amp; Coach on CI Ways of Working to leaders<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Build a working understanding of CI through training of staff at all levels<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Embed CI Standard Ways of Working (CI WoW) as a key component of the FO Management System<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Finance CI staff as change agents<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>CI leading complex change<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Help sponsors develop &amp; implement an effective CI deployment strategy including Smart Automation (SA) opportunities aligned with business strategy<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lead complex change initiatives that require greater change management experience &amp; skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Role model CI Ways of Working<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Finance CI as integrator:<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Integrating the components of Operational Excellence<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Share best practices &amp; enable replication<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Connect interdependent processes systems, data &amp; people to deliver End-to-End improvement<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Promote coordinated CI deployments in Shell by leveraging on CI networks<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Facilitate development of a common agenda (including digitization) through Integrated Process Plans<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> What's the role?\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Subject Matter Expert on Lean Sigma and Change Management methodologies, to coach and train Finance staff, at all levels, on the use of these methodologies to deliver projects and to cultivate the continuous improvement mindset.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Deploy Digital Transformation solutions alongside Process Teams and coordination with SA and IT teams, and own and apply the Agile and Design Thinking methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop credible trust-based relationships and work closely with key senior stakeholders across Finance to define process improvement priorities and to create a strong continuous improvement culture. Work with Operations Teams to identify improvement needs and take the initiative while ensuring the usage of the correct approach and selection \u002F prioritization criteria. Drive the appropriate annual Strategy Deployment exercise to align goal setting across various levels of the organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure effective quality processes are adhered to and appropriate tools and processes are being used to drive Continuous Improvement, adopting Fit4 Ways of Working and principles such as Customer\u002FUser Centricity, Transformational Change, and Agile.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Manage and mentor CI Practitioners in Finance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Define, scope and lead process improvement projects in alignment with overall CI Finance strategy and business priorities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Own the outcome of rigorous, auditable control plans and measurements to drive sustained process improvements for projects under supervision.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> What do we need from you?\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ideally Certified Lean Sigma Black Belt; GB or CIP certification is an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Minimum University degree, with substantial work experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong background in process improvement and ability to deliver significant business results. Experience in delivering change management (e.g. AIM, TiC methodologies) and\u002For digital transformation projects using Agile is an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience in facilitating workshops and coaching\u002Fmentoring activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong team working skills with the ability to influence and motivate large diverse teams including virtually to embrace and deliver sustained operational improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Excellent communications skills, both written and oral.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>The role involves extensive interactions with various stakeholders and therefore requires a combination of intellect, maturity, strength of character, and an ability to earn respect.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Passion and sense of urgency for executing performance improvement projects; Change Agent with strong credibility and influencing skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Self-motivated and possess demonstrated ability to motivate others to achieve results<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Customer-centric mindset and work style<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrated strong analytical, interpretive and presentation skills; able to synthesize complex information and prepare concise, compelling presentations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrated strong process, project management, and change management skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Learner Mindset and ability to adapt to rapidly changing business environment and emerging trends.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role:<\u002Fb><br> As an Accountant, you will conduct all accounting activities related to tickets creation and Book vs Physical reconciliation of plants according to stock reconciliation and recording policy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Performing and supporting operations of Intragroup Hydrocarbon cluster in one of the sub-processes. Providing proactively issue resolution to support process and value chain in Hydrocarbon area. Delivering assigned activities and driving for operational excellence within the team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Operating of assigned scope in the area of Intragroup Hydrocarbon cluster with different dimensions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good knowledge of the respective own sub-process and using of general knowledge on end to end Hydrocarbon process. Being able to back up operators in the respective area of accountability and support during month-end closure, including other teams from the given sub-process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensuring effective KPIs analysis by identifying root causes, implementing and monitoring improvement plans, presenting results from own area of accountability to different parties within Hydrocarbon organization and Business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team support - using various team meetings to raise concerns and issues and provide supporting information\u002Fdocumentation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing information and explaining all the concerns on the process\u002FControl Framework to internal and external auditors including facilitation of the particular meetings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collecting and inputting data with a high level of accuracy, quality, and in accordance with agreed deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identifying and contributing to process improvements and simplification excellence and effective Control Framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><br> We are keen to hear from candidates who have a bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in Economics, Accounting, or Finance. Beyond that, we'd hope to see as many following as possible on Your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> 1-3 years<\u002Fb> of experience in a relevant accounting environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Very Good English (written and oral) B2\u002FC1.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good working knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of GSAP accounting system is desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Financial processes knowledge<\u002Fb> is desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Knowledge of accounting rules<\u002Fb> with a focus on stock accounting is expected.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to communicate effectively within a team and with business partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work under pressure of time and workload to meet deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Trading &amp; Supply has a global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, LNG, chemicals, natural gas, electrical power, and CO2.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This particular role will be supporting the <b>Trading and Supply<\u002Fb> Business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The <b>FC Screening Team Lead<\u002Fb> is part of the Financial Crime Operations team within the Global Financial Crime team. The team undertakes Counterparty Screening – the checking of potentially adverse information relating to a counterparty that may impact our willingness to transact with them.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Team Lead is responsible for the planning and organisation of the team’s work, enabling team members to execute their tasks efficiently and effectively while maintaining interfaces with key stakeholders and providing first-line of defense supervision and leadership for a team of 5-6 staff.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More specifically, your role will include: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Oversight of alert handling within the FC Screening team to ensure its members deliver their screening responsibilities in an efficient, effective way within agreed time frames and KPIs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertake non-standard searches that are either complex, commercially sensitive, strictly confidential, or involve a new set of circumstances not previously encountered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with the High-Risk Approval Forum (HRAF) and the High-Risk Counterparty Committee (HRCC) on the information of potential interest.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communicate team performance and provide monthly screening KPI reports to management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide day-to-day team management, pastoral care, goal setting, and performance reviews. Monitor and allocate daily workload, sharing alert work among available analysts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and implement process and performance improvements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Understanding of Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions, Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) &amp; Know Your Customer (KYC) policies\u002Fprocesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of high-risk jurisdictions and their associated risks, global sanctions requirements, the risks of dealing with Politically Exposed Persons, and corporate and complex entity structures including SPVs, Trusts, and Funds, including identification of Ultimate Beneficial Owners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional experience in a screening role in a Tier 1 Financial Institution (Wholesale, Commercial\u002FCorporate, Investment Banking) and\u002For large Commodities or Trading House (Oil, Energy).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication in English.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to lead, collaborate and work effectively in a team as well as with stakeholders, taking into consideration customer needs and perspectives in day-to-day work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell SBO Kraków is currently looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join the Cloud Platform Engineering team who are accountable for development and operations of the Enterprise Cloud Platform.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Context and Dimensions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> You are a key enabler in Shell’s “Powering Progress” energy transition strategy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You are part of the SRE community, helping drive Shell’s transition through your deep knowledge of Cloud Native capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You are empowered to “automate everything” and driving operational excellence through code, in an environment where it is ok to fail, learn and adapt.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will support Shell’s core businesses across Upstream, Downstream, Renewables and more, through access to the latest in Cloud Native capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will work in an environment where Honesty, Integrity and respect are core principles, reflected in the your day to day life.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will work in a true Agile\u002FDevOps manner as part of Shell’s <b>Cloud Platform Engineering team<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About the Role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Site Reliability Engineer in IT Operations your primary responsibilities are as follows:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work as part of the Cloud Platform Engineering team (global) to deliver world class services to our consuming businesses.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with your Product owner and lead SRE to ensure the PI commitments are delivered on time to the highest quality.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with development partners to shape product architecture, design, and implementations of new and existing systems to enhance their reliability, performance, efficiency, and scalability<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure all key services processes: capacity planning, configuration management, performance tuning, monitoring, hyper automation and root cause analysis.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We are experts in Cloud infrastructure and Engineering best practices, and we help development teams using Cloud infrastructure more effectively.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We are on point for capacity planning and to help teams anticipate and prepare
